title: Game of Thrones
pros: Good work-life balance. Solid pay with significant RSU awards. There are pockets where you get to work with good, smart people.
cons: We all had high hopes for Adaire. We all were rooting for her. Look, the culture before Adaire wasn‚Äôt perfect. There were a lot politics at play and there definitely was some cleaning up to do, but we still felt like we were working for a winning company that continued to deliver results and didn‚Äôt treat us like a number. In the last year, that has all changed. The strategy seems to be simple. Cut as many headcount as possible without impacting the revenue. We now are all a number and worry weekly that we could be on the chopping block next. The most vulnerable are SVP‚Äôs and above. They all have a target on their back since so many have been shown the door and replaced. When you have every executive in the company running scared, it just cascades down the ranks.

title: Incompetent middle management let capable people go

title: Inherent bias & culture that rewards popularity over performance.
pros: -Truly international exposure. I worked daily with colleagues across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC, which broadened my perspective and network. -Strong product portfolio. Supporting Equinix‚Äôs interconnection and colocation services lets you stand behind offerings that customers genuinely value. -Smart peers at all levels. When the company hires from top-tier firms, you meet talented people and learn modern practices‚Äîat least initially.
cons: Nepotism and favoritism overshadow merit. Recognition often hinges more on how well you ‚Äúfit in‚Äù socially (or how many drinks you can handle at the annual sales summit) than on the results you deliver. -Risk-averse leadership. Executives who‚Äôve spent decades rising internally sometimes derail months of work because they get cold feet or feel threatened by fresh ideas. -Micromanagement as self-preservation. Rather than empowering high performers, some leaders over-control projects to signal their own importance. -Empty promises to experienced hires. New talent from FAANGs is courted with talk of big impact, only to see initiatives scrapped or redirected when real change becomes uncomfortable. -Lack of diversity and unconscious bias. The workforce and leadership are relatively homogeneous; decisions that disproportionately affect employees of color often go unexamined, and bias awareness is minimal.

title: poorly executed change

title: Less talk, more action

cons: There is little collaboration and too much kingdom-building. The layers of leaders tend to manage upwards, leaving front-line managers in the lurch with little to no direction. title: Rudderless
pros: Decent pay. Not top-tier but likely at least in the 70th percentile or higher. Phenomenal benefits. Seriously I've been pretty spoiled by tech industry benefits as a whole but aside from a mediocre 401k match (typical 50% of 6%) with a industry sub-par vest (25% per year over 4 years) Equinix's benefits were among the best I've ever had... and the 401k benefits were only mediocre/sub-par by previous employer/tech-industry standards. They're pretty average as a whole.
cons: Lots of initiatives, little follow through and even less accountability Delays, delays, delays - that reorg that was supposed to be done in 6 months? Basically still happening 4 years later after multiple changes in scope and "re" announcements. Maybe one or 2 of them actually "completed" but the job didn't seem to actually change or if it did, it seemed to barely catch its breath before announcing another re-org/change to the point it at least felt like one long continuous re-org that was forever delayed. Those quarterly goals that by definition should be allotted the entire quarter to complete and should be easy enough for management to proactively plan ahead for? Yeah they're still discussing them and they'll get released 3-4 weeks, maybe even 6 weeks, into the quarter; and dont be surprised if we add or update a goal in week 8 but dont worry it'll be an easy one. Most of the goals were meaningless busy work too or things that you'd do one quarter but the next quarter would be completely useless thanks to the re-orgs (not sure how we're supposed to build job training content when you cant define the role or what value the content brings if you are telling us the role will be significantly different in 6 months time). Plenty of managers who dont seem to actually do anything but not much room for career growth unless you're really close buddy-buddy with a manager. Have pulled the rug out from customers multiple times with facilities closures and sunsetting of services (particularly metal). Sub-par raises. Tool-happy. Have a problem? There's probably a tool for that. And if there's not, we'll build one. Why fix the problem when we have so many tools we spent tons of money buying or developing ourselves for you to use! Poor communication across teams that are siloed and many are very rigid rather than helpful, too stuck on adhering to process and not enough on doing right by the customer. Quick to escalate to management overly-sensitive teams with a major blindspot for their own behaviors. Got an escalation to my management once for not responding to an email timely. It was a fair criticism but I pointed out I simply overlooked the email and the person in question never followed-up directly, just took it straight to management. Some months later, that person failed to respond to me, after multiple follow-ups I finally got them on a call and asked why I wasn't getting a response. After the call, they escalated to management that I "cornered them" on a call. Wish it was just the one person but had multiple similar interactions with people weaponizing the core values defending nonsense over business professionalism

title: Read the reviews. The culture is the problem.

title: Know what you are getting yourself into, I wish I had!
pros: Working for one of the worlds largest data center companies is a nice boost to your resume, you will get exposed to a lot and work with many smart people. There is plenty of work and pay and benefits package is decent. Stock is solid and ESPP is nice.
cons: Leadership will preach work/life balance but in reality they will work you to the bone and make you feel guilty stepping away for any length of time. Unless you are part of the good ol' boys club, you can expect to be micromanaged instead of empowered, chastised in front of peers even though the company values say everyone should be treated with respect, and you can expect no support for career advancement training or being able to attend industry events. Leadership is bad - really bad, unless you happen to be related to someone high up (yes nepotism exists) or served in the US military. They will push their work down to you and then after it's done, try to claim it as their own so you don't get the chance to shine. Also, forget about getting any praises for a job well done, constructive feedback or annual reviews, you will just get sent an email if you didn't do something so they can use it against you later.

title: Excellent place to work with good benefits
pros: Disclaimer: I work in corporate Operations, not in our datacenters (IBXs). There seem to be significant differences in expectations and culture between the two. * Pay is fair * Benefits are incredibly good * Company culture (in corporate) is really healthy, though it depends on your manager. Up to the executive level, there's an open door policy, and most of the executives are friendly and willing to talk * HR practices are steadily improving * Hybrid work is encouraged, as of spring 2023. No requirements to work in-office more than 1-2 days a week. * Employee resource groups are very active and employees are encouraged to participate * Plenty of recognition for good work * Excellent internal mobility opportunities
cons: * Most of the corporate offices are open floorplans, which can make it hard to focus in office. * HR practices for people with disabilities aren't great, though they're very actively working on making things more accessible and inclusive across the company. * Pay is lower than competitors, especially in Operations * Operations and Corporate are quite siloed and I've heard from a lot of the datacenter employees that they feel ignored/undervalued by Corporate

title: Once a great place to work is now just a typical cooperate America company
pros: Pro's are Paid time off and roles over each year with a max of 250 hours. Equinix offers ESPP and RSU's are typical. All the sales reps I have came in contact are great. Equinix does a great job at hiring the best sales people. In almost 9 years I never had one issue with any other coworker and quite a few have become lifetime long friends. Yearly sales kick off to Vegas is an awesome experience that Equinix puts in a lot of effort and money into. P-Club is also another amazing experience that Equinix puts a lot of thought an money into. Equinix is the best of the best when it comes to anything Data Center related and that why they can demand such premiums. Decent offices.
cons: Cons are- low compensation and based salary compared to most other similar roles at other big tech companies. Always changing the comp plan for the worst. Every year the comp plan is cut down and try to make it as complicated as possible. You will work harder and bring in more revenue but get paid less every year. There's a lot of guessing into how you will be paid and half the time the comps aren't paid correctly or have to wait months. Equinix in the last 2 years has really focus on commission pay outs and making sure they can claw back as much as possible. As a global company they have made cross selling with other regions difficult so they do not have to pay full comp if their are multiply reps involved which in a lot times multiply reps are needed! Also, for the last 2 years, Equinix seems to have really focus this effort and money on DEI. I am all for diversity but it's a point where it's in your face 24/7 now. Volunteering is being pushed harder every Q as it seems now it is more mandatory within the company. If you are comfortable in your AE position it looks down upon as you should aspire to be a manager or director one day. There a lot of great team managers and there are few who should not be managing a team. Equinix is huge on promoting within which is a huge pro but a lot times they will promote AE's to management level with no experience or training and seems to be based on how much they like you and not so much your performance. My former manager constantly canceled calls, was late and half the time was somewhere else (why her team was the worst performing). Equinix does not care about loyalty at all! No severance package for tenure reps that have been with Equinix for many years. It's a shame as Equinix was once a great place to work but the Cons now outweigh the Pros and they are chasing away great people. Just another corporate America company where you are just a number, nothing less, nothing more.

title: Great and yet, not so great.
pros: The business opportunity for Equinix is extraordinary. If the company can clear a path for successful execution of its cloud strategy, it stands to become a powerhouse in the technology arena. The success of the company has served its employees well - compensation packages are very attractive and there have been few to no layoffs over a decade. Generally speaking the employees at Equinix are very nice people and many are extremely passionate about, and dedicated to, the company's success.
cons: As the company goes through a period of significant growth, the cultural is drastically changing. Moving from what was a start-up feel - all for one, one for all - to big company attitudes and politics. At the leadership level there is so much in-fighting that they are not unified in their approach to the opportunity we are so blessed to have in front of us, instead they are battling for recognition and building empires. And, the company's success has them believing that they are so good at their jobs, that they are unwilling to take feedback from the rank and file that perhaps all is not well in the kingdom - they conveniently chalk it up to the pace of growth and rest on the belief that "everyone is replaceable" as a convenient excuse for why key employees are exiting the building.

title: Engineering leaves much to desire
pros: Benefits like ESPP/RSUs, amazing data centers with key locations and excellent/friendly technicians, being known as "The Internet" given the interconnection/colo presence with a neutral-leaning business stance, there are quite a few awesome engineers and managers, a recent series of management changes to provide new(and hopefully, better) direction/vision, and possible peering options.
cons: Performance reviews are a joke(Pulse survey/SMART goals): sure, there is career coaching and 1:1 sync-ups occasionally, but management rarely takes the feedback seriously and doesn't appear to have the courage to do anything to break modus operandi and improve things. For the current and potential power Equinix has, management and senior management squabble and squander it constantly with political fights leaving casualties being the customer(and their customers) and the employees. There is a heavy contract workforce causing quality issues and a rotating one in keeping the taxable employment down(and profitability/dividends up) justifiably so to some extent. The speed and scale with which software engineering delivers is astonishing for the workforce size: they're a byproduct of poor management, constantly shifting priorities/reorg'ing, and a lack of capable engineers. Additionally, not enough engineers rebuke plans/ideas and, in turn, endure a poor work/life balance that comes out in production quality which I think has lead to a state of mediocrity at best.

title: Amazing company; I'm blessed to work and grow here!
pros: I *LOVE* working at Equinix. We have an outstanding culture. Our leaders truly care about employees. Colleagues here are hugely supportive of each other "Put We Before Me" (one of our Magic of Equinix values). We get to do really cool work that matters and has an impact. I can tangibly tie what I'm doing to our companies objectives, it's very satisfying. I get to try lots of new things in marketing, we're *always* innovating. AND, our CEO's "I'm safe, I belong, I matter" value system means I can really be myself here. I can be a senior leader *and* a mother. I don't have to separate those 2 parts of me. Especially during COVID with 2 kids in a house while I'm on zooms, we are all encouraged to do whatever is needed to be ok. Our CEO/CHRO put in a "Wireless Wednesdays" plan to help us all deal with COVID burnout. It has enabled me to get back to critical thinking about my area of the business - when was the last time you got to carve out time every week to do that (or whatever else you need to do in order to cope with the workload/COVID stressors)?!? There's a huge propensity to promote from within - far beyond any other company that I have worked at. My manager is amazing, she values all aspects of me. I love recruiting and telling people just how amazing Equinix is and when they join here they come back and say you really were right about it.
cons: There are no cons. My kids love Equinix too ;-)

title: An Exceptional Company to Work for
pros: I consider myself very fortunate to work for such a great organization. To start, upper management and the C-Level truly care about their employees well being. They instituted ‚ÄúBetter Way Day Wednesdays‚Äù as a day to avoid internal Zoom calls when possible so employees can get a bit of a breather on ‚ÄúZoom fatigue‚Äù and catch up on other work tasks like training that they‚Äôve been meaning to do. One of the best things I love about Equinix is their continuing efforts to innovate and make smart investments in the platform. They are truly a technology driven organization and have a positive impact on their customers, employees, stakeholders and frankly the world. Another differentiator is everyone‚Äôs positive attitude. At other places I‚Äôve worked, their was always negativity and disgruntled workers. Here everyone is happy about working for a such a great organization and it‚Äôs rare, if at all to come across an unhappy employee. Everyone is also so willing to lend their support at a moments notice. As far as I‚Äôm concerned I want to complete my career out at Equinix.
cons: Hard to think of any, but maybe they can soon relax some of COVID rules currently in effect like allowing more people in the office and conference rooms.

title: Balanced company
pros: Career development opportunities: Equinix is a rapidly growing company, which provides ample opportunities for employees to take on new challenges and responsibilities, learn new skills, and advance their careers. Collaborative culture: Equinix has a strong culture of collaboration, with a focus on teamwork and a shared commitment to delivering excellent customer service. Competitive compensation and benefits: Equinix offers competitive compensation and benefits packages, which can help employees feel valued and motivated to perform their best. Strong focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion: Equinix has a strong commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, with initiatives such as employee resource groups, unconscious bias training, and a diversity and inclusion council. Access to cutting-edge technology: Equinix is at the forefront of the interconnection and data center industry, which means that employees have the opportunity to work with the latest and most advanced technologies.
cons: High workload: As a rapidly growing company, Equinix can be fast-paced and high-pressure, which may require employees to work long hours and take on a heavy workload. Limited work-life balance: In some roles, such as those requiring on-call support or shift work, employees may find it difficult to achieve a good work-life balance. Limited remote work opportunities: While Equinix has some remote work options available, many roles require employees to work on-site at one of the company's data centers. Complex organizational structure: Equinix is a complex and highly decentralized organization, which can make it challenging for employees to navigate and communicate across different departments and regions. Limited opportunities for advancement in certain roles: Some roles at Equinix may have limited opportunities for advancement, depending on the specific area of the business and the employee's skills and interests.

cons: We are definitely at the cross roads of the next big thing and that can sometimes feel like we are stuck in mud. A lot of big decisions to make and sometimes too long to make them.

title: Unmatched Company Culture
pros: -Strong Company Culture: There's a difference between saying your company prides itself on a strong culture and actually living up to the initiative. Managers have an open door policy, communications are always delivered with transparency, and your input is never disregarded. -"Great people produce great work": employees genuinely enjoy what they're doing and that's made clear the second you step into the office. The effort put forth is always backed by passion. -Fast pace environment: this is often seen as a "con" however success isn't reached without momentum. Equinix serves and provides for an industry that is growing at a rapid pace, those on the back end need to keep up. -Always looking to improve their strategy: If there are gaps in either internal or external communications the company doesn't sweep it under the rug. Different organizations are constantly developing strategies to troubleshoot and identify the problem to improve moving forward. In addition, the company does not have strong hierarchical barriers. It doesn't matter if you're a VP or an associate, the communication you have with those within the company are always respected. Executives are humble and care about their employees.
cons: So far I have not identified any cons in my experience as both a contractor and now full-time employee.

title: Re-orgs happening
pros: - Promotes inclusive culture - Good pay and benefits - Nice offices with hybrid arrangements
cons: - Going through growing pains and leadership churn, which causes uncertainty and poor leadership decisions as a result. They did a round of layoffs and the reason for the layoffs made no sense at all. This also leads to the second con....poor communication. Every time the leadership announces a change, they veil it behind some wording that makes it sound benign and perky, but it is far from it. That is not transparency! Also, the leadership fails to listen to the lower ranks. They make decisions in a bubble and do not bother to talk to the boots on the ground. They forget who they should be serving, customers but also their employees, whom tgey hired because they are good at what they do. There is no trust there with the employees. Company as a whole works in silos and this makes dependency management an absolute nightmare.

We have a great team of business partners to work with from Tax to Legal to HR and Payroll. Standards are high but hard work is rewarded. Great people and culture, an ethical tone at the top, and tremendous success in the marketplace are probably the greatest assets of the company overall.

Of course, these are "high class" problems in a sense because the company is doing so well, but these are challenges nonetheless.

title: Growing and exciting but no warm fuzzies anymore
pros: Generous compensation package, strong stock growth. Personable and energetic C-Level execs. #1 in its industry, with no signs of growth slowing. Customer-centric.
cons: Culture has deteriorated as certain new execs have come in. Lots of talk about the importance of culture, and investment in programs that promote the value of the of culture, but it does not play out in personal interactions and definitely not in management styles. Good culture is not spawned from recognition, it happens naturally when people are in it together. There is lot of friction between teams, worsened by frequent organizational tweaks. Employees are horse-traded between departments. If I had a $ for every time my management told me or a colleague NOT to assist another team, or to "let something break" or implode in order to get attention on it, I would be a wealthy dude!

title: Great company, some weak teams.
pros: Excellent company with great benefits and work ethic from most employees. WFH and flex time allow for good time management. If you land with a good team, working with Equinix will be worth your while. Do EXTENSIVE research prior to accepting an offer. Read between the lines of posted job descriptions and reach out to current employees to get a better insight as to the role and the team.
cons: Be wary of certain teams/managers. There seems to be certain teams that are quite disorganized and chasing their tails constantly. Frequent moving targets (sometimes hourly!). When everything is urgent, nothing really is. IMO, Equinix was not ready for a remote work model, it is quite difficult to know which contacts to make, yet are expected to 'already know who to go to' for information. Other than my immediate team, I had very little contact with anyone else in the organization. To this day, I still don't know who my HR contact is. As someone mentioned in a prior review, "The company has a complex structure that is difficult to reach".

title: Excellent Place to Work
pros: The Company is executing solidly on the following 3 key fronts ( CEO is a key driving force behind these): a) Vision: Company has a well-defined strategy/Vision called Platform 2.0 that is making the company ready for the next generation workloads/architectures like 5G, AI, Blockchain, Multi-Cloud etc, business models and customers. b) Company culture: Our CEO regularly meets with employees of all pay grades and listens to their concerns and aspirations. He has regular calls with all middle level managers and takes input about what is working and what is not. Employees are recognizing each other via a program called Magic of Equinix. Employees feel safe and are excited that they have a career growth path at Equinix. c) Business Execution: The company is consistently surpassing its quarterly business goals. New data centers and services are being announced at an aggressive pace. Company is aggressively coming up with new channel relationships and partnership models.
cons: Equinix business model is unique and it works. The company is expanding at a fast pace. Need to be even more aggressive with respect to expanding in countries where you currently are not present.

title: Temp to hire
pros: I had the opportunity to meet some great people The work was challenging in the beginning
cons: Pay was below average Upper management would not provide solid answers in a timely manner Unorganized If they hire you as 'temp to hire', even if you perform well they will most likely not take you on. They have constant budgetary issues and don't want to invest in people long term. They take people on, make them believe they will stay in the role permanently as long they you perform well, but once you start asking for feedback they just keep saying 'they don't know' or 'we have no answers at this time'. They also have zero courtesy, they will give you only a few days notice that you are let go. You work hard, perform well, show respect but at the end of the day your efforts are pointless. Find a company that appreciates intelligent candidates with a positive and professional attitude.

title: A Company with Integrity
pros: - Great CEO. - Great diversity & belonging and wellness initiatives, and a true emphasis on employee-run clubs and supporting well-being. - Wonderful people overall -- only a handful that I haven't loved working with and a few have moved on by now. - It's an especially great place to be right now since it's so well situated during the pandemic, too. - My manager has been very understanding with flexibility (within reason) due to my childrens' needs. - Pay was very good, and bonuses depending upon the group. - The recent reorganizations have really made sense for the business, and have been about making impacts in the organization rather than cutting costs.
cons: - Pre-COVID, work from home flexibility varied by group and was dependent upon the manager. - A few years ago, one of the groups had a lot of roles cut without communications to others. I haven't seen this in awhile, though.

title: Transcendent Company and People
pros: There is a pretty big leap between wanting to be a great company and being a great company. Equinix is a great company. They do not just talk about what it takes ‚Äì they do it. The magic here is real ‚Äì and it stems from intent. No one (no company) will be perfect all the time, but decisions are made, people cared for, clients cherished, from a place of ‚Äúgood intent‚Äù all the time. This is a family. The energy is contagious‚Ä¶ and unique. I have been in the industry for 25+ years. Only once (briefly) have I ever seen the combination of talent, experience, energy and honest, genuine desire to do what is right in service to clients, employees, and society.
cons: High rate of activity. Lots of change. If you are looking for status quo, you will not find a lot of that here. Also is not a huge company (although not tiny) ‚Äì you need to engage, be personable, and want to make a difference. If you don‚Äôt, you will find the openness and culture of collaboration omnipresent.

title: Equinix is a GREAT Place to Work!
pros: I have been overwhelmed by the kindness of the people I work with. This is a place where people come together to support and guide new employees -- I feel like I have found my home! At Equinix people want to help you succeed and are always willing to lend support to make sure that happens. Our values and culture is not just lip service - it is woven through everything we do! I feel like it is ok to be human here...I am given time to support my family when necessary and no one looks down on that -- it is encouraged!
cons: A lot of meetings! Could use more clear direction on what programs are important, but think we are getting there

title: No Better Place To Work Than Equinix!
pros: As an employee, being a part of the family of Equinix is truly valuable. Not only do I get to be a part of the top data center and colocation provider worldwide which screams success but I am a part of an organization that cares! They care about their customers, communities and even more so about their employees. Equinix makes it a point to allow us to shine in our individuality, fosters a space where we are all accounted for and feel included. They encourage growth and opportunities which can't be said for some companies. Not many companies can boast about their employees appreciation of where they work but Equinix can. I am truly blessed to work here!!!
cons: Because Equinix is such a great place to work and appreciates the highest level of talent in their prospective employees, getting in the door can be challenging. With constant growth comes the need to be flexible so be ready for change and enjoy the ride.

title: Client Service Manager
pros: Great People Innovative products Decent benefits Work from home options
cons: Work life balence is awful. It's not just the balance, but the workload is that of a slave and there is little to know remorse from management. This makes the "magic of Equinix" seem fictitious. Additionally, the roles and responsibilities are not that of a CSM in the industry, instead all work is reactive and task driven. Processes are ridiculous, sometimes pages long, and there is an expectation for CSMs to basically know everything.... CSMs are also held responsible for most everything when things go wrong. Some how, this continues to be acceptable by the leadership team. There have been lots of lost promises for change, but they continue to saddle this team with burden and no relief. It's been years of promises! It's even difficult to take PTO, you are required to find someone to back you up and usually teammates don't want to cover even more workload, so you end up begging people to cover for you... it's terrible. In general, there is way too much pressure on CSM teams...

title: So far, so good....
pros: I started here recently and am really enjoying it. I read all the reviews prior to accepting my offer and all the comments of "extremely fast-paced" and issues with work-life balance made me slightly nervous. While the company is fast-paced (emails flying around at all hours) and things do happen quickly, it's not excessive or overwhelming in my experience. Do make sure you have the right manager and team; be open about your needs during the interview process. Most people do have families so schedules are flexible and management is understanding. The culture has definitely been great, my coworkers have all been really kind, patient and willing to answer any questions. This company is really doing so well, get on board while you can!
cons: The fast pace may not be suitable for some. I've worked at several of the large tech companies in the area and it's not much different in my opinion.

title: Communication Associate
pros: I started as an HR intern and I really enjoyed that experience because I had the autonomy and empowerment to work cross functionally and explore new projects. There was a number of social and development events to attend so our class of about 70 interns bonded well. My senior year, I received a job offer to start after I completed my undergrad degree. I was placed in a role where I've been able to make high impact in the HR Comms team as we are building innovative communications programs. The culture and size of Equinix allows me to jump in on this important work as we begin to scale and focus on employee experience. Everyone at the company is willing to help you grow and learn and I‚Äôve been able to develop my skills immensely.
cons: Although Equinix is a tech company in Silicon Valley there aren‚Äôt amenities like free meals (just breakfast) or large scale events to get to know other employees.

title: Great financial performance doesn't compensate for highly political, dysfunctional culture
pros: Highly competitive compensation and excellent stock performance. Company's data center services are in high demand. Flexible work schedule. Some committed, hard-working people, but many who are just playing politics.
cons: Unfortunately, the company's financial performance simply doesn't make up for a culture that's rife with politics, dysfunctional relationships and arrogance. If you're a "yes" person who plays political games well, you'll do just fine here. If you bring energy, original ideas and assert yourself, you probably won't last. The Marketing organization in particular suffers from a tremendous amount of back-stabbing and dysfunction. This certainly points to a lack of leadership, and most executives seem to be more concerned about protecting their own images and careers than helping to shift the culture in a more positive direction. There has been an exodus of talented people as a result.

title: The grass is greener!!
pros: During the interview process I would ask everyone, "Why Equinix?". The common answer was the people and the culture and they could not be more correct. Everyone from recruiting, interviewing, on boarding and the departments I deal with on a daily basis make this statement true. Polite, courteous and helpful as well as go above and beyond to make you feel welcome to the company. They talk about being transparent and they are. Information is power and they believe in sharing it openly. Great work life balance and offsite events are planned for employees to know that they are valued. The CEO and the executive team are visible, accessible and provide frequent communications.
cons: I have not found any yet and don't expect to!!

title: Great stock, some terrific people, highly political corporate environment
pros: The stock plans were great. The staff in the IBXs were top notch. There are some really good, smart, motivated people at this company. It was great to work for an organization with such a solid track record of success.
cons: Highly political environment in corporate. If you have been there for a long time you don't have to work much and are protected. If you are newer you take on the bulk of the work and are held to completely different standards and expectations. If you manage up well, you will probably do well here. If you are the kind of person who focuses on doing a good job and doesn't play the political game you will not be appreciated.

title: Excellent IT/Cloud pro-serv startup.
pros: The best thing I can say about working at Nimbo is how human the company is. Management does really seem to care about the working environment and career paths it provides to employees, and does genuinely listen to and act on people's concerns. Nimbo is also good about facilitating teamwork and collaboration, making it a great place to learn and hone one's skills. Some of the projects and technology we have access to is very impressive as well and makes for interesting work. I also really like the team - I couldn't ask for better co-workers.
cons: There are few drawbacks other than what one would typically encounter with a fast growing small company - namely a shortage of process and ever evolving expectations and roles. Some people enjoy the challenge of an evolving workplace, but others who prefer a more static set of roles, responsibilities and expectations might chafe at the dynamism of the environment.

title: Fast growing company, good place to work
pros: Good work to life balance, good working environment, company is growing rapidly so job stability seems certain. Training at Equinix goes as much as you're willing to learn, there is always something new to learn every day and good opportunities to grow with the company.
cons: Lack of Manpower, Lack of overtime pay. Some days the workload calls for more than a given 8 hour day and the company is very reluctant to pay that overtime.

title: Awesome Marketing team
pros: Marketing at Equinix is viewed as a very strategic function which is unusual for a tech Silicon Valley company. CMO is active voice on strategy and also leads products team. Real can-do attitude within the team. Real fun environment where people work hard and play hard. Marketing leadership team really works to drive for best practice (and there are several areas to improve because Equinix has grown so fast that at times it feels a bit like an overblown start-up.) Culture at company is taken very seriously -- its not just about the results but also how you get them. As a result there are very few jerks (and the company tries to avoid recruiting jerks and egos).
cons: It's hard work and the pace of change might make some people uncomfortable (however marketing attrition is very low and Equinix attrition in general is low.) The big focus on culture might make some people uncomfortable if they don't like the focus on soft skills and how you relate to people.

title: Talent Acquisition
pros: Great "family oriented company", people really care about you. I'm often struck by how much time is spent talking about personal life. In fact just the other day I bumped into our CEO Steve Smith in the elevator and the first thing out off his mouth once I said hello was "How was your weekend?" - The CEO asking me about my weekend? AWESOME!!! Their charitable giving program and priorities are really amazing, matching your chosen charity contributions generously and prioritizing overall corporate giving towards internet access related projects at scale to ensure that ALL of earths citizens have an opportunity to participate in the educational and global marketplace advantages the world wide web has to offer. Obviously with 52 straight quarters of quarter over quarter growth and recent admission to S&P500 the company is going really well, which provides lots of opportunity for growth!
cons: Still a start up feel after 17 years in business. Equinix is growing very fast and working in alignment from the front line to the board to install infrastructure to ensure success at scale.

title: Professional Services - Consultant
pros: ESPP - Have you seen the stock price! Printing money. Travel budget is loose REIT status is competitive advantage Most of the leadership is competent Pay seems to be competitive
cons: ultant

title: Lack of leadership in Marketing
pros: The pay is good, and the line workers are nice. The business is solid.
cons: Good people are quitting every week. There are big departures across Marketing due to lack of leadership. People are not recognized for their work or value. Perhaps most unsettling for me was that there was zero interest in diversifying the leadership team. Perhaps emboldened by the CEO who posts Biblical verse on LinkedIn and promoted his political allies after winning the CEO job, there was zero indication anything was ever going to change. There are lots of calls and pretty messages about diversity, but the reality was truly ugly. Also concerning was the fact that there was zero vision in Marketing. Nothing that excited me, and no view what so ever of where marketing was going, why and what we were going to do about it. So I left and am much happier.

title: An outstanding culture!!
pros: - Flexibility - Work Life Balance - Healthy and respectful collaboration with team members and management - Wonderful culture - Many opportunities to join in with your coworkers on giving back to the community/volunteering - An atmosphere where you'll find you are encouraged to bring your best and opportunity to bring with you into it your own style into your daily tasks and contributions and sharing ideas with those on your team who bring also their best every day!
cons: While the company and teams continue to make leaps and bounds in improvements, there can be at times challenges when it comes to manual processes and can hinder efficiency. Still the objective being to do things and the correct way so these things can take time. There are several internal tools for promoting employee feedback to share such challenges that have the eye of leadership for continued improvement on process.

title: Overall a good experience in HR
pros: I was in a global talent management role in HR and enjoyed my experience, particularly with my team. I found my teammates within our department and across other lines to be very personable, supportive, and engaging - which inspired a lot of the work that I collaborated on. I also had the opportunity to travel globally, build a team, and co-lead major initiatives. The relationships I developed during my time there have extended beyond my last day, which is great!
cons: There are cons within every department, and I think the biggest challenge at the time was trying to figure out what it would take for me to get to the next level in my career. Sometimes the feedback was inconsistent. But, having said that, I also received helpful feedback that has set me up well for success in my new role - and I had access to career experiences that were very enriching.

title: One of the best companies I have worked at. You will work hard and be part of something great.
pros: Many challenges to help you grow. You will be rewarded if you perform well. Fun and exciting technology. Nerve center of the internet.
cons: There is a lot of growing pains. As the company expands there are a lot of processes lacking. There is no work life balance and at times you feel you are at a start up. It is hard to stop working after a 12 hour day. In some cases you could work 20 hours a day and still not be caught up.

title: Growing pains...? Well, they're ALWAYS growing!
pros: They hire for culture fit and it shows. When people get along and have common goals its amazing what can be accomplished. Even with an unrealistic work load, there is a feeling of happiness going to work.
cons: Hiring for culture can lead to teams feeling cliquey. When there is a focus on inclusiveness, how do the two reconcile? Did I mention inclusiveness..., yeah? With a focus on speed speed speed (have to stay ahead to stay relevant), and a mind for acquiring anything with potential for revenue, there is an expectation to do more work with less resources (see above mentioned unrealistic work load). That is an equation for burnout.

title: Sales
pros: Pro's: opportunity to make VERY good money. No structure, undefined goals and objectives, weak leadership which make it easy to pave your own path. If you're strong in sales and have your own style, you will not be told or shown otherwise. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and don't need guidance, direction or training and thrive in a wild wild west mentality then you'll enjoy your career here. Rapidly growing company which create lots of room for movement. Strong name to have on your resume.
cons: Culture is thick with sexism and misogyny. Leadership lacks integrity, vision and skill. Good-ole-boys are promoted regardless of skill set. If you don't have the Frat boy mentality or don't want to conform, you will NOT fit in here and will not be promoted.

title: Overall good experience, but be prepared for bumps along the way
pros: - Amazing earnings potential - Great benefits/stock plan - Good people across all organizations - Service delivery is rock solid - Great value proposition, tremendous growth - Spectacular employee events - Very respectful work/life balance A pretty amazing company history and current trajectory. Upper management really has a handle on the business and does an amazing job.
cons: - Finicky culture favors tenured veterans; historical disparity in treatment between 'rock stars' and the rest - Some growing pains, lots of reorganization in sales - Despite tremendous overall growth, brand not recognized in some verticals - International regions still not fully integrated - Occasional feelings that you are starting over from scratch - Sometimes whispering, some backstabbing

title: Great Company with a solid vision; Growing pains and uninspiring leaders in some areas
pros: The company is well positioned for ongoing success and has a rock solid business model and product mix. Most of the people are dedicated and great to work with. Most of the C-level executives are approachable, highly competent, accountable, really care about employees and are dedicated to making this a great place to work.
cons: Newer management during this high-growth phase can be uninspiring. Big talk about strategy and high level goals is great, but without appropriate resourcing or a real willingness to listen and understand what it takes to implement things is resulting in frustration for many. There are a lot of execs landing at Equinix from the same few former employers, which can lead to some clubby behavior.

title: A company guided by strong sense of culture and values
pros: - Supportive colleagues who truly care about one another and assume best intent when confronting challenging situations - Ability to safely take risks and learn new things in the process - Employees who are truly invested in, and actively contribute to, company culture and outcomes - Employee wellbeing pivotal aspect of all company decisions - Transparent and open communication from top leaders - Employees celebrate one another when there is success and accept responsibility when things go wrong (rather than place/shift blame)
cons: Despite the size of the company, it does not function in a typical hierarchical manner which means much opportunity to work directly with leaders at all levels. This is refreshing but can sometimes stall the decision-making process where many opinions are considered.

title: Great Company, Great Outlook, but room for improvement
pros: The culture has adapted well over the past three years. Top Management (Chiefs) listens and responds well. The stock doing well doesn't hurt either.
cons: It's tough communicating upwards within departments (to VPs). VPs will talk through people instead of being direct. Titles matter too much to many employees that work there. VPs can be too focused to hit internal figures instead of focused on improving the world and our industry. It's very tough for entry-to-mid level employees to work your way "up".

title: Mixed
pros: Great benefits, company is doing really well, great decisions regarding financial health, company is transitioning to scale so lots of fun work to do.
cons: Cliques rule. If you are part of the "in" crowd, regardless of whether you deliver results, you are golden. Hardly any good leaders below that Exec level in terms of valuing employees. Not a place where, if you are looking to grow into director or above, you will get a lot of sponsorship. Place is top heavy, so very few of these spots open and everyone is competing for these few spots. Common complaint from peers is that there is not a lot of appreciation and recognition by their direct managers or management in general for jobs well done.

title: Great Place to Work!
pros: I have been a happy Equinix employee for 10+ years! I have seen the company grow into the global market leader through great strategic decisions by leadership, organic growth, M&A and lots of hard work. It has been an exciting ride. I appreciate that the great culture and values of Equinix have not changed despite our rapid growth and that's thanks in part to attention to this issue from all levels. At Equinix, employees take pride in the company and its successes. There is a focus on employee development, recognition programs and a new focus on employee wellness which is appreciated. As an employee I feel respected and valued. It's a great place to work and I have no plans to look elsewhere!
cons: Sometimes with rapid growth there can be growing pains... Certain years the amount of work has felt overwhelming and I know some employees have felt burnt out. But I think management is getting better at recognizing this and addressing it.

title: Best company I‚Äôve ever worked at and I‚Äôve been employed at other top fortune 100 companies in the valley.
pros: Excellent bonus plan! Work/ life flexibility, highly inspirational environment that motivates you to be your best. Company pays your select charities for hours spent volunteering outside of work. Highly collaborative and positive culture.
cons: Benefits should be more competitive. Even though parental leave is enhancing in 2018, it still is not competitive enough to attract top notch millennial talent from companies like Facebook, Amazon, Netflix and Google that offer 100% paid parental leave for at least 4 months. Need better cafeteria option in HQ. The food is not that great for the price.

title: Equinix is...Family.
pros: As with most people with full time jobs, I spend more time at work than I do with my family or friends...so I darn well better like the people I work with. ...and I do! We are a family here and we all row together. Highly recommended place to be. It certainly helps that the Macro IT trends are moving with Equinix as well. Connectivity has never been more important than it is right now.
cons: It's a bit tougher to make a killing here in Sales than it was in the past. But the compensation is still at or above market rates, particularly if you bring in new business.

title: Extraordinary people working together to make our ding on the universe
pros: Highly energetic, passionate, and intelligent co-workers Strong cooperative spirit across the global organization Executive leadership is extremely engaged with our people and culture (it's not uncommon to see them scooping ice cream at a company social, volunteering at a Heart Walk or attending a interns event at a local baseball game) Cross-department collaboration is strong (there is a general love of celebrating the team win) People are committed to their work and high standards of excellence
cons: Super fast pace of work (hey, it's not for everyone!) Lots of projects going on at the same time and vying for attention Constant growth mode = constant change (sometimes we have to build the plane while it's flying) Lots of M&A activity

title: Marketing
pros: Company is very successful and positioned to do well for at least 5 years plus. People are really nice and treat each other with respect and kindness. Not sure if that is true up the ladder of managerial status.
cons: Marketing organization has a low key vibe that is boring. Work is done only at your level - so it's not a big melting pot of cross functional exposure and ideas. It's a very hierarchical organization - you don't really work with anyone above your "rank".

title: Stepping Up When it Counts
pros: Equinix and their senior leadership team has really stepped up to support us during the COVID-19 pandemic. The leadership always preaches the Magic of Equinix and how great a company culture we have. I have worked with companies where all this turns out to be empty talk when it comes to tough economic conditions or some other type rough spot in performance. The leadership has really stepped up the past couple of months to make sure people are maintaining family priorities, providing flexibility where needed and providing tips for keeping your schedule under control during this time of too many Zoom meetings. You hear put your money where you mouth is - we've seen this the past couple of months.
cons: The thing I think the company needs to work, that has become visible during COVID-19 are working effectively as a unified global company. Equinix reorganized a year or so ago and is still working to integrate the teams on the ground.

title: Ground-breaking Marketing Department
pros: Equinix is literally the IBM of the datacenter space....you know the saying, "no one ever lost their job for choosing IBM." The same is true of Equinix. Others may be cheaper, but Equinix is THE company in this market. It's the premier brand. Everyone else copies them. Are their more sophisticated marketing organizations overall? Sure. However that misses the point of how exciting it is to establish something truly new. Working here is a LOT of fun.
cons: The work/life balance is hard. It's a real estate company at the end of the day...so they can spend huge on CAPEX, but must run with a fraction of the bodies you would find in a comparable tech company.

title: Senior Project Engineer
pros: Great team members across the globe who are always willing to work and help get things done. You can learn what you want if you want to put in the effort.
cons: Lousy managers. The Peter Principal in full effect. The company seems to do management rotations that do more to damage the company than anything else. I was on one of the most respected go to teams in the company and within 1 year of rotating in a Sr Manager who had no clue as to what the job entailed the entire team had quit to go onto places like Apple, Amazon, Google, Facebook. Yah, that's the kind of quality you can't afford to lose.

title: Great culture
pros: Equinix provides an environment that allows employees to learn and grow in a culture that promotes cooperation and innovation. Often vendors working with us are quick to say, "we have never worked with a company like this -- you really know what you are doing and internally you have great coordination between teams". I have been here 10+ years and am proud to see the early, entrepreneurial spirit of Equinix continue. We see efforts from the CEO down to promote and preserve our unique culture. In recent years we have developed Equinix Employee Connection Networks (EECNs), groups built around identities and communities that are underrepresented at Equinix or those that have faced historical discrimination or share unique challenges. These EECNs are open to everyone at Equinix, including allies. Everyone at Equinix is invited to connect annually through our Days or Understanding, a 24-hour, around-the-globe event where employees come together to share, listen and build trust.
cons: There really are not any.

title: An excellent company
pros: Solid/stable company with a growing future. Competitive pay/benefits. Lots of training classes and things to learn, not boring. I've been in this industry for 15 years and this is the best company that I have ever worked for.
cons: The only cons that I could think of are going to be the same at any company you could work for. You might not always get along and mesh well with every single person in the company but that is to be expected anywhere here on planet Earth. People love to complain in this (cons) section but Equinix really is a great company.

title: Keeps getting better!
pros: + Culture + People (diverse in all ways) + Leadership; especially the deeply experienced, long-term, leadership in finance, legal, and HR, help us stay on track, grow and bring more value to employees via stock and benefits + I do feel like "I'm safe, belong and I matter" which is a mantra here + Future prospects for continued growth are still very strong + Employee resource groups + The company cares about my health and well-being and provides lots of flexibility. + Commitment to sustainability + Giving back to our communities in many ways + Beautiful, functional office space with lots of good things like snacks, all kinds of beverages and great coffee, lattes, cappuccinos, expresso, etc.
cons: - Like most companies today, we are transforming our business and processes for the future and that means lots of change which can be dizzying, at times, but the people + all of the above pros far outweigh any cons!

title: Awesome company with lots of potential for growth!
pros: Equinix is the best kept secret in the Silicon Valley. The leadership of this company is beyond compare. They are visionary, yet approachable and friendly. The CEO is incredible and very down to earth. The company fosters a very friendly, community environment, and it's full of smart, driven people. At the same time, there is a decent work/life balance (for the Bay Area). The executive leadership listens to employees and makes changes accordingly. Finally, the company is definitely headed in the right direction, which affects the stock price and their ability to compensate their employees well.
cons: Some typical process and systems growing pains. Non performers rarely get weeded out.

title: Opportunities to grow, learn, have fun, crush it
pros: Market leader, hyper-growth dynamic offers employee opportunities to evolve, culture of commitment and service, real investment in employee programs, stellar E team
cons: - we go to the same people for everything; there is an entire crop of new talent to get to know and leverage for strategic projects, and we should - although there are some challenging it, we have legacy thinking embedded into our systems, tools, products, and customer engagement

title: Career Defining
pros: I worked for Equinix for almost 4 years and it was a career defining experience for me. Equinix is the leader in their space because of their focus on excellence. That focus goes into everything they do. Great people who are passionate about doing what's right. Great leadership. CEO rocks.
cons: In my group there was a lot of change in leadership and the organization which was distracting. It was a little concerning in that there was not clear idea on when things might settle down. Sometimes it took longer to get things pushed ahead. There wasn't a good sense of the culture which might be different now.

title: Best company I have ever worked for!
pros: The culture is the biggest pro of working here. Never have I worked with a group of individuals who are not only incredibly talented but are kind, caring and inclusive. Everyone values what others bring to the table and always encourage team members to speak up. Management is also really great at finding ways to elevate your work and recognizing efforts. When you work in this type of environment it‚Äôs so easy to want to do more and be better. Additionally, the company stands by their values and all employees constantly rally around them to serve our customers in the best way possible.
cons: The company is growing and growing fast! While that sounds like a great thing sometimes it can lead to inefficiencies, redundancies is lack of clarity in ownership or decision making.

title: Great Opportunity to Drive Change
pros: Equinix continues to grow rapidly and build on its market leadership. The company has a clear vision and strategy for the next phase of its evolution. This creates an opportunity for all employees to help shape the future of Equinix and means that day-to-day initiatives and programs are about driving change. Equinix is an S&P 500 start-up. This translates to a highly successful company that values the entrepreneurial spirit and focuses on ‚Äújust getting things done‚Äù. The company culture is one of building and transforming with passion and humility.
cons: As Equinix evolves, it is challenged with creating strategic alignment across organizations and establishing global processes and planning. Equinix has not fully transitioned from an ‚Äúaim, fire, ready‚Äù approach to ‚Äúready, aim, fire‚Äù in order to ensure achievement of the desired results and maximum impact.

title: Better than I could have hoped for
pros: - Respectful culture that extends from the Executive teams all the way down. - Diversity, inclusion, sustainability and other modern issues are actually taken seriously and initiatives embraced at the highest levels. - Good pay - Decent benefits - Great market position and overall job security for good workers - Response to COVID has been genuinely great.
cons: - This respectful culture can *sometimes* cause issues in making decisions about a direction that doesn't include all viewpoints. In trying to bring everyone's ideas to the front, it's sometimes hard to make the choice to exclude something for being incompatible. These would be things like business processes, initial focus for products and general business changes. Really not a big deal and better than the alternative in a lot of ways.

title: Global Ops Engineering
pros: If you are a go-getter individual, this is the place to be. Equinix personnel are top performers and the brightest I've ever had the opportunity to work with. The company‚Äôs business model keeps evolving and always looking for growth opportunity within the internet business global platform. Thanks to our Board of Directors for having the wisdom and vision to make this company grows into a multi-billion empire, which really makes work even more interesting and challenging
cons: The company is growing too fast and if not careful in acquiring potential companies. Equinix will loose as a Global leader in Internet Business Exchange platforms and connectivity worldwide..

title: Toxic at best
pros: Paid well for an entry-level position.
cons: Management showed people a concert where someone was peeing on someone when reported it was ignored. Was hired for higher-level work was put as a basic tech and told to get over it. Everyone there trying to prove they are better than you so they can try to move up and show management that you suck don't let them move up. Talk down to you while training or make sure you get the worst work they don't want to do not act as a team throw the new guys to the wolves. Each building has 2 management if you got 1 building everyone was great and not toxic the other 2 are stressed and toxic even on slower days.

title: Awesome Culture
pros: The people. Period. At every level of the organization, the people here are smart, hard-working, creative, and take a partnered approach. People drive culture and Equinix has the best culture I've seen in the Valley (in fairness, I've only worked at a handful of companies in my career). Our stock price is also doing well which is a great bonus!
cons: Like all growing companies, we are managing scale and all that comes with it. It is not necessarily a con, but from an employee perspective, does create challenges. The environment is fluid and workload is heavy. But that is to be expected in a rapidly growing organization. It helps to genuinely like and respect the people you work with and believe in the direction the company is heading.

title: Politics and Backstabbing culture, esp. Marketing
pros: Salary and stock are great for some jobs. There are also a lot of talented, fun people who work hard and care about their performance. If you are on the right project the work can be challenging and you could travel for fun events.
cons: The management team is a nightmare. Leadership is asleep at the wheel, doesn't weed out problem managers, lets bad behavior fester. VPs are running functions with no experience in the kind of marketing they do. Bean counters and introverts don't inspire creativity and passion. Most managers are also totally uninterested in the well being of the people who report to them, are more worried about politics and their own best interests. If things get bad, managers will throw you under the bus to save their own necks. I've seen some really incompetent managers keep their job year after year and good, experienced people marginalized if they aren't spending time stroking the right egos. No one can get ahead if they are below director level. Do not come to Equinix if you are good and want to advance in your career, as you will never get promoted. If you are less competent and good at politics, know someone on the inside, and willing to brown nose every day then you might end up in a great job that you are not qualified for, and you will have job security for life. I know very few people who are truly happy in their job in marketing, which is a shame, since most of us deserve better.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Truly global player across cultures and technologies. A place to learn and advance with a strong crop of expert colleagues to collaborate with to really meet the customer needs. Innovation is everywhere and no limits to allow employees to shine. Rewards are generous and achievable and for those who go the extra mile additional benefits are awarded.
cons: Micromanagement of some issues in some functions, short term achievement focus for country teams instead of mid to longer term goals. Due to expansion, may scare some customers away as they may perceive an "all eggs in one basket" risk scenario

title: Pro's and Con's of Equinix
pros: Fun and energetic atmosphere. Wide spectrum of experienced people in various verticals. Operationally sound and a well-oiled machine. The ability to meet all walks of life globally. The company has money and isn't shy on spending a little internally. Training is extensive.
cons: Company view marketed internally as a "Promote Within" organization, but hiring Executives actions dictate an exemption from the policy. A tendency to disregard reality of the marketplace as a whole. Disfunctional Midlevel to top level communication. Newly hired Executives with agenda's that don't corespond to change that's empacting, and sustainable.

title: Highly political and dysfunctional marketing organization. Terrible management.
pros: Competitive compensation packages, bonuses and stock options. Enjoyed facilities and working with some talented people.
cons: Lack of accountability and leadership, particularly in the marketing organization. Infighting, back-stabbing, dysfunction, inflated titles, arrogance and politics flourish here and are the worst I've seen. It's all about "protecting your turf", power, and image at any costs. Implementing new ideas to actually help Sales and improve processes in a positive, effective and measurable way aren't welcome (unless someone else in a political power position gets the credit). If you are a robot or just a "yes' person who likes to take orders, you'll do fine here. As a result, many of the top talent has left. No amount of compensation is worth one's sanity.

title: Great environment and lots of on job learning
pros: Learning new technology related stuff on your job every day is something you enjoy working in the product engineering team especially when business problems are solved with technical solutions - The feeling is amazing !! Architecture team working on next-gen architectures/technology .. Equinix hired couple of great visionaries in their product Architecture group and implemented great culture of solving complicated problems and knowledge transfer within the team and across the organization .. in last 3 years company has delivered a towards their ultimate vision and on the right track of executing their vision for multi-cloud market.
cons: Lower employee to contractor ratio, sometimes it is difficult to find quality contract workers

title: Being at the right place at the right time!
pros: I followed an old manager, not really thinking about what the company did, it was more a close commute that worked for my part time hours. How lucky did I get, from I walked in I realized this culture of continuing success was right where I wanted to be. Did I mention I lucked out Since Equinix most recently was named on the Forbes list of Fastest Growing Tech Companies, the Deloitte Technology Fast500 and the InformationWeek 500 list of top US technology innovators. Equinix was also added to the NASDAQ-100 Index, which is composed of the 100 largest non-financial stocks listed on the Nasdaq Stock Market based on market capitalization. Did I mention I laugh everyday at work!
cons: Cannot think of any cons to working here!

title: Awesome company with great perks
pros: Very aggressive company with huge growth with many opportunities around the world.
cons: There is nothing technical to be learned as a operations technician as this is why they are hiring people with no knowledge.

title: Too Much Overhead
pros: The company has a great culture and it's a friendly environment to work in. The success of the business has delivered great benefits, esp. RSUs, which makes us very fortunate.
cons: It appears we're moving toward big company structures, including the addition of lots of overhead personnel with the proliferation of roles like chiefs of staff.

title: Best And Most Thoughtful Company
pros: I've worked for 5 sales companies in my career and every company I've worked for has always said how much they value and care for their employees. Some companies have made mild attempts to show that and others just say it and don't really show they mean it. Equinix means it and shows it! I've never been so happy and felt so appreciated before as an employee and team member. Everyone from the CEO down to new entry-level hires makes you feel welcomed, heard, and appreciated. I couldn't have made a better choice in joining the Equinix family!
cons: There are some complex internal processes that can create a little headache at times. These processes seem to change often. Although these processes seem ridiculous at times, I have faith in the leadership here that changes and complex processes come with good reason.

title: Company Culture is the Heartbeat
pros: Equinix has an incredible culture. The company not only speaks to diversity, inclusion and belonging, but then puts the programs and structure in place to have this realized. The company provides support to its employees with accessible managers and growth opportunities. A work life balance is encouraged, along with giving back to our communities and the world through philanthropic efforts.
cons: At times it can be challenging to find the information documented that is needed to provide accurate guidance. This is because some of the repositories are not updated fast enough, or don't have dates associated with the update to be certain it is the most up to date and relevant information.

title: Insincere culture cultivated by insincere CEO
pros: Good stock. Great business model. Nice building
cons: If you end up at Equinix, you will hear from a variety of c-suite leaders, starting with the CEO, who inundate you with an endless barrage of passionate, insistent and even teary-eyed proclamations about their sincere interest in creating a safe, diverse and inclusive culture. But be wary of those who proclaim too much. Nearly all of these c-suite leaders are insincere charlatans. Since joining Equinix, I‚Äôve watched as C-suite leaders have not been held accountable for very bad behavior that is anything but inclusive and tolerant. Meanwhile, a large number of diverse employees have left the company while others have been passed up for white Christian candidates. The CEO loves to profess, but he will not hold his c-suite accountable for behavior that would make anyone who isn‚Äôt white and Christian feel safe. The hypocrisy and insincerity are appalling. But hey, we sure do talk a good game here.

title: Terrible management, very political and toxic environment, especially in Marketing
pros: With the stock, (which can't continue to be given out as much) the pay for certain jobs can be good. There are some truly great people below director level, very talented and fun. If you like to travel you can end up going almost anywhere depending on your job. The data centers are fantastic, really high quality. You can feel good about putting a customer there.
cons: -No career advancement at all -Very political and back stabbing, most managers don't care about their direct reports, only about themselves and their perception. They seem as scared about losing their jobs as we are. -In marketing, it is often more about how you report what you do than what you ACTUALLY do. In many roles, there is little actual marketing really happening. -Company sings a great culture tune but it isn't practiced. Morale in many departments is terrible and instead of fixing it they threaten people about their "negativity" and treat them like criminals. -There are often the wrong people running projects. Instead of hiring experts in the field, people without the real skills are in charge of managing people who do know what they are doing, and the manager won't listen to those with the experience. There are some exceptions, but they are few. -There is no trust between the workers and management. People can't say if things aren't right, even though we are supposedly given the chance with the "survey". No one believes it won't come back to them. And any low ratings a team lead is given don't matter - they just give lip service to making changes or getting to the root of the problem. It never changes. -The real reviews for this company, especially marketing, have been pushed down by a concerted effort by management to get people in the company to write good reviews. They even hired a social media expert to fix it. Scroll down to last year and before, and you will see the reality of working here. It is sad, but true. The problems have only gotten worse as we get bigger.

title: nepotism reigns supreme
pros: Literally no pros unless you use equinix as a stop gap, you cannot have a career here unless you are family or friends
cons: Management doesn't even know how to teach techs how to do thier jobs. Management favors few and gives them better bonuses and raises. You will be micromanaged. Reviews are few and far between. Pay is not equal. No shout outs for accomplishments.

title: Find the right team
pros: Solid pay and RSUs, great industry and position within it, has money to spend, remains customer-focused even as it scales, draws some truly smart and effective coworkers, solid financial leadership, great employee giving match and social responsibility efforts.
cons: Politics, maneuvering, overwork, inability to prioritize work at an enterprise level, vastly varying employee experiences, unresponsive HR services team, slow launch of integrated IT tools, 'popularity contest' culture, disparate policies by region. Has a good start on DEI (DIB), but with no true equity-based recruiting plan, progress stalls.

title: Great potential - please don't screw it up!
pros: A global giant in the neutral colo space and the recent launch of Cloud Exchange has added to that aura! Thanks to the stock performance, total cash comp is very competitive. Mostly competent people and a generally genial atmosphere. Also, very much a "play hard" culture.
cons: Dysfunction at the top is increasing by the day - makes any cross-functional collaboration extremely difficult. Leadership traits vary from paranoid control freaks to "tone deaf" leaders totally in awe with their own smartness that they can't stop talking to listen! It's a good company if you are a mechanical or electrical engineer. Stay away from Marketing and Technology development!

title: Don't work in the marketing group
pros: - Beautiful office right by the water - Decent benefits - Nice coworkers - Good work life balance - Job is very secure unless something happens that makes data centers obsolete (unlikely)
cons: Perhaps because Equinix has such a powerful competitive moat around its core business, they have little motivation to build a competent marketing group. Leadership in marketing has no vision, leadership capabilities, or inspirational qualities. All they do is fight amongst themselves, make poor decisions, discuss fashion choices and hire bad people. The brightest and most ambitious people have moved on and all that's left is people who are only sticking it out because of the stock price and to have a steady paycheck until they find something else. There's no upward mobility, their technology systems are broken and old, and you will spend years of your life here with have nothing to show for it when you interview at your next job. Stay away.

title: This boat will sink soon enough.
pros: Salary and compensation. The colo data center environment is a great place to be.
cons: Old and tired micro management leadership with a peddler mentality. Working at Telx is a nightmare. The top performers are getting their numbers and success through attrition and their assigned account base. Over 80%+ of "new" sales are with existing customers and logos. New reps are left to fend for themselves with little support and many never get accounts and are pushed out of the business with 3-5 months. Deals are split between reps just because a rep has an account in their name in SF and this creates a great deal of favoritism and exclusion.

title: Real Estate Company Acting Like A Technology Company
pros: Competitive pay compared to other data centers Benefits
cons: Lack of technical experience for direct supervisors 12-hour shifts with very little work/life balance

title: The Worlds Leading Digital Infrastructure Company - includes software & services....We Got This and More....!
pros: Great company to work for because of the people, culture, caring for the employees and the CEO that walks the walk and talks the talk with sincerity, integrity , honesty and emotional intelligence. He has a strategy and a roadmap to go with it! Global teamwork is the name of the game and what we do! The company has taken great care in creating programs , outlets and initiatives that support well-being of all employees during these trying times.
cons: Like everyone else, sometimes you yearn to meet with your team face to face, but Zoom has to suffice for now because of COVID.

title: A great culture with a positive outlook in an innovative company that is by far and away the industry leader
pros: The company is not shy about helping employees succeed both personally and professionally. Everyone works together well toward a collective goal for the company's success, and recognition abounds. There are social events multiple times a month to get employees together and management does a great job keeping everyone informed of key developments on a regular basis.
cons: While work-life balance can be a challenge, the work is always interesting and challenging - sometimes you just need to put in the extra time to get it all done with high quality.

title: Best company with a great future and a recommended work place
pros: - Employees are encouraged to undertake further training to benefit their careers. - Flexible working hours with the option to work from home in certain situations specially COVID-19. - Best Companies have always had a strong emphasis on internal workplace culture, the result of which is a strong team who share a common set of values. The people who work here are the atmosphere they create is nothing like anywhere else I have ever worked. - My manager is extremely supportive, kind and genuinely cares about me as an individual. - Internal and geographical mobility - Collaborative culture, smart and experienced people
cons: Nothing specific to the company itself as its great company to work around the world

title: Its really THAT good!!
pros: Where to begin?!! - Pay is very good, but the stock and bonus are impressive! - CEO felt the company was working hard, said "lets take a couple extra company days off". Wow! - Leadership (starting with CEO) truly wants the best for their people and customers - not just lip service! - Family comes first - work/life is wonderful - Employees love Equinix and they work hard - some very bright AND caring people! - Option to work fully remote from anywhere - Good global connection with Teams
cons: - Employee break area ran out of my favorite flavored water one day üòâ - I got nothing....

title: Great Opportunity!
