pros: This company is very passionate about building a thriving and sustainable culture, to the point that they dedicate time, resources, and funding to it! Benefits are great as well as the stock options. What I love most is that there isn't an invisible wall in between the executives and the employees.
cons: To ensure they get the best people, they have a lot of interviews --- so be prepared to meet with tens of people! Prioritization is still something that they're working on fine tuning (as with any growing company).

title: Rigid and Top Heavy
pros: Good people, great moat for the business, very sticky and hard for customers to leave
cons: Bureaucracy has overrun the organization. The customer is no longer at the center of everything we do and it‚Äôs a sad day. New ideas are crushed and processes have become so onerous nothing can be accomplished to satisfy customers. The poor customers are stuck with the under staffed and extremely overburdened support staff. While the executive org continues to grow with leaps and bounds.

title: Good crew, Management is so so. IF you want training, you better already have it
pros: Good team work, met some good guys. OT was hardly frowned upon. Nice stock plan. Decent benefits. Always had a good Christmas party.
cons: Micro managed, site is near capacity for cross connects in certain parts. THey like to cherry pick OSHA rules especially with ladders, but techs will whiz by on portable scafolding without locking them down when running cross connects. Absolutely no external training unless its from a salesmen. Majority of work is removing old cables. I've seen employees try to advance and management hold them back. Pay is average for the industry depending on qualifications and experience.

title: Bullying and Ego's
pros: Steve (CEO) is amazing and inspirational.. Can we cookie cutter him and all have him as our manager?
cons: GTS.. The senior leadership in this group are bullies!! Management is passive aggressive and is putting the entire work force in a very uncomfortable position.. It's not a one time thing and it's not just from one team. It appears the senior leader is driving this kind of behavior. Egos are huge!!

title: Re-org is taking too long, some works are paused for a year
pros: Corporate culture is good but it also depends on your boss.
cons: A small group of decision-makers who make decision without collecting inputs from all levels, hence, people focus on managing up. You have a big group of stakeholder but your performance is evaluated by your boss who doesn't talk to or doesn't care about your stakeholder.

title: I can bring my whole self to work at Equinix.
pros: A company that fully lives it's values and allows employees to be their full selves at work. Equinix cares about its people and puts undeniable emphasis on Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging. The non-hierarchical culture encourages employees to be agile in decision making and creative in problem solving. Those in senior leadership never hesitate to reach out and make time for employees across the business. An absolute stellar response to the pandemic in how employees are on-boarded virtually, how teams stay connected, and how as a business we still perform in the face of adversity.
cons: Working on global teams sometimes means having early or late meetings to accommodate regions, though never occurs frequently enough to cause problems.

title: The Best Well Rounded Company
pros: 1. Employees health (mental, physical, and monetary) is put first 2. Encourage learning new skills and find your niche within the Org 3. Leadership handled COVID situation flawlessly 4. Is a "green" focused company; not all about the profits 5. A giant tech company with a start-up vibe
cons: 1. Slightly management heavy; A change process has a lot of touch points 2. Being global there are different process in each region, which makes it hard to have a standard process 3. With 10,000 employees hard to know who does what, if you need something

title: Account Executive
pros: Equinix truly is where opportunity connects. I joined Equinix 4.5 years ago, and have had an amazing ride! As a sales person I have had the opportunity to support some of the largest brand names in the world, and have helped to grow our market share with large global Enterprises. The culture is supportive, and challenging, and I have consistently made more on my W2 every consecutive year.
cons: We run a really lean organization, so sometimes we have to work long hours. However, most sales people are used to this as part of our job.

title: Director, IT
pros: Growth story, strong positioning in the Cloud and data center space, has good solid, bright smart people, a lot of them sticking around for the growth/stock appreciation.
cons: Too many C-Level executives for this size, spend a lot of time competing against each other. Net result is layers of people doing "busy work". Too many networking people in the DNA of the company to let new technologies come to fruit.

title: Overall, the best work environment I have experienced in my 30+ years in the Valley!
pros: The people, including Senior Management, are trustworthy, fair, and work well together. The Compensation and Rewards program is robust. Senior Management cares about employees. The company is growing, yet continues to examine ways to "get better". I am lucky to be here
cons: Growing pains, some regional/corporate infighting, lack of systems and some resourced. All can be fixed, and some fixes are already underway

title: I only wish I had come here 10 years ago
pros: The "Magic of Equinix" is more than a tagline and set of principles -- it's embedded in the culture. The customer is always at the center but is surrounded by a set of values for our employees that are lived and supported every day. The leadership team embodies and exemplifies the values from the CEO down -- "I'm Safe, I belong, I matter." It's wonderful to be an executive at a company where there is no balancing of the words and actions.
cons: Global diversity can strain resources not accustom to working globally

title: Great place overall but getting to be a bit presumptive and arrogant in relation to customers.
pros: Good (but not over-the-top) pay and benefits. Good opportunities for personal training and development. Some jobs have good travel options (like sales).
cons: Senior execs seem to be resting on past accomplishments and not really staying abreast of changes in the market, technologies, and customer requirements. All of these areas are better understood by middle management and soldiers in the trenches, though.

title: Sales Director Equinix
pros: Growing industry, market leader, innovative
cons: Growing too quickly, bureaucratic, political, loss of focus

title: Equinix - solid company; could use some fixes to make it a truly great place
pros: Very good people, some politics but healthy business means people are generally in good mood and helpful to eachother; people believe and are excited about the company for the most part; the company appears to have very good momentum and an opportunity to be a leader in the industry Best treated groups: Sales - definitely a sales oriented culture -- these people get really treated well Legal - this group enjoys very good quality of life for they pay they make Marketing - has among the best salaries and titles for the quality of people (though they do not appear to be widely respected within the company)
cons: rapid growth means some teams are hiring too quickly and quality of staff is not consistent across teams (sometimes people are overqualified or underqualified for the title they're hired in at); quality of life and compensation are not always fair across groups; company is very collegiate and favors "getting along" and there is a little bit of a "get on the bus or get off the bus" attitude that makes it hard to give open feedback Finance - works among the longest hours and like many finance organizations the culture is work hard and grin and bear it Operations - the key to the company but the leadership in this team rules with a very heavy handed approach and does not encourage going outside of the group and sharing group "secrets" with others

title: Wouldn't change a thing!
pros: Great team all around. Flexible with schedule, flexible with work location. Travel opportunities, great pay/benefits, and management.
cons: They have a high churn due to employment sectors where there are more companies that pay a higher rate. But you can't compete with Amazon/Microsoft/Facebook/Google etc. on every level.

title: Some good people, poor manager
pros: Decent pay, employee stock purchase program, 401K.
cons: The strange phenomenon of mediocrity rising in management, and data center operations is in a stagnant, self-perpetuating loop of not incentivizing good techs to stay and therefore only disinterested ones remain.

title: Incredible Culture
pros: Equinix has the best culture out of anywhere I have worked. The culture is not hierarchical and includes everyone. Managers are working to protect the culture as the company grows and increase benefits to employees as well.
cons: The company is becoming more global and growing at a rapid pace. As a result, the company is having some growing pains - which is to be expected. But overall a very solid place to work!

title: Equinix - the best place I've ever worked
pros: - Extremely people-centric culture - Frequent interaction from people around the world - Generous bonus and stock programs - Intracompany mobility happens regularly - Hybrid office/remote work plans - Extensive diversity, inclusion & belonging networks - Sustainability and corporate social responsibility leadership
cons: - Still experiencing some growing pains with immature business processes - "Focus on a few key priorities" is the talk but not the walk - On your own to manage work life balance (it's supported but not systemic) - Can be very difficult to get things done when coordinating across the silos in IT

title: No Complaints
pros: Pay is commensurate to work. They more qualifications you have, the more opportunities there are for advancement. The company is strong financially and continues to grow and expand. This growth and expansion should lead to steady employment for years to come.
cons: Work can be stressful. Equinix advertises a nearly error free computing environment which pressures it's staff to maintain habits that are 100% free from human error.Maintaining a high output error free day is difficult to say the least.

title: Good, but with growing pains
pros: Indeed, a positive working environment. Most people are naturally friendly and helpful. Compensation, especially RSU & ESPP Our data centers are great and business is good Opportunities arise, though career path is quite unclear
cons: Lack of focus: with the growth, the company is trying to do everything at once, and prioritization is not Equinix's forte. HR: Human Resources seems too busy to care about employees. They want to work with projects which will give them visibility, but dislike talking to employees

title: Great company if you have a good manager
pros: Great company overall. Execs are easy to speak to and encouraging. Compensation is fair. They promote work-life balance and offer meditation and yoga. Wellness program is a fantastic bonus.
cons: I have a micro-manager and am trying to get into a new team. Company promotes career-pathing and most practice what they preach but I have experienced otherwise and feel I have been "kept down". This manager is not in line with the company culture and we pay the price.

title: Big Company in a booming industry
pros: -Free lunch every wednesday -Good benefits -High stock value with employee discount (free money) -Company is actively growing every year. In my years I thought it was a good company and a great opportunity to get in to the data center industry. The company was extremely progressive and saw growth in many aspects; high sales, new high profile customers, new facilities, acquisitions each year I was there.
cons: -Company is very very big (which is personal preference) -Career development is slower, with a big valuable company comes with hiring more experienced outside talent to protect their assets.

title: Overall, Good Company to work for...just depends on the team
pros: -Mid-Size Company where you have the opportunity to get involved in a variety of projects -Global locations: London, Amsterdam, Rio De Janiero, Singapore, Hong Kong to name a few -Executive Leadership driving strong stock price -Collaborative culture
cons: -Some recent hires who are direct reports to Senior Executive leaders do not demonstrate nor exemplify the core values and do not appear to be held accountable for his/her behavior

title: Incredible culture combined with Amazing Opportunity
pros: The culture of this company is absolutely phenomenal. People are empowered, collaborative, and embraced by the organization to bring their whole selves to work. The increased focus on wellness, diversity, inclusion and belonging was fantastic, but to also double down on that while going through this year and COVID just shows how much this place cares about their employees. The work is incredibly rewarding too, with the opportunity to shape and drive entire industries.
cons: Infrastructure isn't as sexy as some other industries - if you're in it for glitz, you might want to look elsewhere.

title: Proud Team member of Equinix
pros: * Equinix embraces change. * Equinix challenges you to be your best, rewards you for your ideals. * Equinix welcomes all cultures. * Equinix is happy with diversity. * Equinix values their team now matter what your job title is. * Equinix appreciates you as a person and a team member. These are the top reasons why I love to work at Equinix, there are many reasons, but these are the stand outs. I am very proud to be a member of the Equinix team.
cons: I cannot thing of any cons here. You must accept the challenge to be your best. This is the only con, if you cannot accept the challenge, no need to apply.

title: Great starting point
pros: Good place to start a career in a data center setting from a trade setting.
cons: Pay is stagnant for the first few years. You get a shift differential at night then lose pay going to days so they end up paying you about the same from start through the year 4-5.

title: Dream Job
pros: Life balance, culture, being valued as an employee. They walk the talk.
cons: Can‚Äôt think of one single down side so far.

title: Fantastic employer, inclusive culture, industry and market leader
pros: Equinix is a fantastic place to work, with excellent benefits including pay as well as a positive work life balance. The company is committed to DE&I, and the leadership team from Charles down to management walk the walk. Easily the best corporate environment I've been apart of in my career.
cons: Not many. Company is geographically disperse, which can lead challenges in meeting with other teams. Older legacy systems and processes can bog down the flow of end-to-end for customers, though leadership is well aware and we're working on improving.

title: Global Operations Analyst
pros: Good medical, dental, ESPP, 401K benefits
cons: I worked as a part of the Global Operations Strategy team for 9 months at Equinix. It is the worst experience I have ever had working in Silicon Valley. The work atmosphere is extremely hostile - constant bickering,bombarding. While Equinix is a great company to work for, the global operations department has the lowest employee satisfaction ratings and the way it is run speaks for it. There is no room for creativity, innovation- just do what you are told to do. There is a lot of favoritism - if you are in the good books of management your life is comfortable and good, else you are in hell! There is a top down management execution failure in this department. I would advise anyone to stay away from the Global Operations strategy team at Equinix.

title: Come for the Business Growth, Stay for the Culture
pros: Strong business growth provide engaging work and reward Leadership by example of a people -first culture All around good people here
cons: We work damn hard! As in any successful company - you need to be sure you find a healthy work life balance, here it is encouraged and acceptable so be sure you make it happen for yourself.

title: Great Growing Company
pros: Great energy and culture -- motivated teams that work together to achieve the goals Company emphasizes health and wellbeing and provides lots of tools and opportunities to do so -- up to the employee to take advantage of those Business model is sound and need for Equinix's services is continuing to grow Compensation/benefits are good
cons: Company is growing in a macro environment that isn't. Adapting to that growth can be hard. moving away from consensus driven decision making, making faster decisions, streamlining priorities and reducing the number of stakeholders to manage are some of the shifts that are in flight.

title: Laid back culture, but sometimes putting a smile on everything isn't for the best
pros: Friendly, laid back culture; great benefits; growth company in a growing industry; active in community as well; flexibility was huge as well, as some were able to work remotely often
cons: Sometimes negative input is frowned upon even when it's constructive, some people are worked harder than others

pros: Great business model, great compensation and benefits. They work hard and play hard. Lots of energy and excitement - employees are proud to work here.
cons: The culture is shifting away from what defined Equinix as a great place to work. Frivolous with their spending - can benefit form bringing in the reigns. Management has a difficult time making tough business decisions to drive extraneous cost out of the business.

title: Most incredible culture I have ever been a part of with phenomenal leadership
pros: The leadership is incredible, from the CEO into all levels of the organization. Leaders and employees live the values of the organization (not just words on a paper). Leaders focus on serving our customers, and doing right by employees. The company has been incredibly accommodating, compassionate, and empathetic throughout this pandemic, and helps all employees feel like they are safe, they belong, and they matter.
cons: Opportunities for improvement with some internal processes, however, company is working diligently to address.

title: Place to do the best work of your career!
pros: Great people and culture. Some of the best executives I've ever worked with because of their intelligence, spirit of fun and real integrity. The company invests in developing employees and creating an effective working enviornment for every person to do their best work.
cons: Fast pace! High standards. Be ready to work hard and be personally invested in building your team and maintaining the values of the culture.

title: Acknowledgment , Change, & Growth
pros: Building some genuine and long-term relationships
cons: Equinix sales is essentially a boys club. Higher ups refuse to acknowledge the immaturity and the outrageous actions that are done even by management. Equinix is a place where who you know will get you promoted no matter if you are qualified for the position. There is little to no room for women to feel comfortable to speak on what is taking place because fear of backlash and career suicide. I believe the company preaches way too much and management does not lead by example.

title: Avoid "Product & Engineering"
pros: - Compensation/stock are good for the industry and area. - Looks decent on the resume. - That's about it.
cons: Management is 100% tops-down. Seniors spend their time engaging in politics and asking middle management to figure out details they haven't fully understood, which are passed onto individual contributors who are too inexperienced to do so. Constant burning platforms and plans being thrown out the window because of new political developments at the top. Individual contributors have no voice and cannot influence what they deliver. Your skills are only useful if they help your manager deliver something to their manager. Customers and quality are not part of the equation. More effort is put into presenting upwards than building quality products. Paired with the constant chaos described above, talented contributors burn out quickly and teams become revolving doors. Work-life balance is not a thing here. Work is continually being done and discussed over 3 time zones. Teams that should be working together cannot. Some days start at 7, some days end at 1am. There are, however, daily calendar invites for 15-minute wellness breaks, and a meeting-free day that nobody adheres to. There is nobody left who understands customer behaviors or our existing systems. It feels very odd to work with teams who don't understand the things they're building. Test environments are frequently broken and inconsistent with customer experiences, which are a messy hodgepodge to begin with. Rather than fix debt, teams drop their work and chase new goals cooked up by disconnected management. Nothing gets done. Lots of siloing, incomplete features, duplicate work, and competing systems that have to be reconciled. Management never acknowledges these and simply marches forward with whatever they're tasked with that week. It's no wonder the products are so poor. Upward mobility doesn't exist here, on any level. There is no framework for growth if your only contributions are jumping exactly as high as you're asked to.

title: Aggressive and yet laid back!!
pros: Just doing as-is is not okay. You are encouraged and expected to redefine, reshape and improve. That's the kind of culture that ensured that Equinix continued to surpass revenue projection for 60 consecutive quarters. A very diverse, fun and forward thinking culture. Very employee focused and everyone gets a piece of the pie.
cons: None I can think of.

title: Good place to be but you're not going to stretch and grow here
pros: People are all very nice, benefits, stock options and other perks are incredible. They pay well and really take care of their employees financially and in terms of work-life balance.
cons: Not very innovative. Stuck in the old ways of doing things; not open to new ideas. Same people get tapped over and over again, not giving opportunities to others or the possibility of a new way of doing things.

title: If you don't know much about Equinix, you are missing out!
pros: When making your decision on where to work, don't underestimate the importance of culture. Equinix is the best company I've ever worked at in my long IT career. When you are surrounded with the happiest and most talented employees in the industry coupled with an incredible culture you get a company that has deleivered 70 straight quarters of growth!!!
cons: I wish I would have joined a decade ago

title: Fantastic company with amazing outlook
pros: Company strength and trajectory - pioneering, future first thinking; Corporate culture, all-around dedicated employees who are as smart as they are kind; Commitment to do good for people and the world at large; Ability to bring your whole self to work.
cons: Not a lot of upward career momentum - takes a long time to be promoted, if ever; New projects/priorities which makes it hard to find balance especially in an always-on COVID-19 world.

title: It works but nothing special
pros: Steady paycheck and benefits plus 401k. Clean and controlled environment. No one breathing down your neck. Also they give you polos for work though xl is sometimes a bit hard to come by.
cons: NO way to move up the ranks unless you're related to someone of come from a certain area of the world. Also management since they're all friends and family, most aren't qualified individuals for their positions.

title: Great culture, best place I have worked
pros: The company genuinely cares about their people. This has shined especially during COVID and racial justice, and has always showed through investment and recognition. They also care about their customers and focusing on the customer experience backed through investment and staffing. The executive staff is very impressive, tenured, and focused. They focus on the right decisions for the long term.
cons: The company is becoming large and growing very quick. It has growing pains and processes are becoming more difficult as they often do.

title: Amazing, Caring Culture combined with Awesome Growth Opportunities
pros: I've been in high tech for over 30yrs and at Equinix for 3. Equinix is by far the best company I've worked for. Equinix challenges you to be your best, rewards you for your process improvement ideas and empowers you to make change, while at the same time protects you to ensure you are safe and cared for and I'm super blessed to have the best manager ever.
cons: We have a few growing pains because we're growing so fast but that's what makes it so exciting here.

title: This is the place to be!! Its truly MAGICAL!
pros: We are recognized quite often for our efforts and success. Peer to peer recognizing Excellent teamwork, everyone rallies around you and supports you. "NO", and it's "NOT MY JOB", our not in our vocabulary. Equinix truly cares about us and encourages us. Defined org chart. Excellent benefits Employee stock purchase plan Flexible hours when needed Great support from upper management Great support from across different departments Great Opportunities for career growth and personal as well
cons: If you are not customer-centric this is not the place for you. If you are not a team player, this is not the place for you.

title: Believe the hype
pros: The culture that the company has built is nothing short of amazing. The executive team leads by example and truly cares about each employee's experience. You will hear employees talk about "The Magic of Equinix." You know how you often hear how great something is and you think to yourself, "I'm sure it's good, but it can't be 'that' good"? Well, my personal experience is that Equinix has been that good and possibly even better.
cons: I'm not sure I can really identify anything as a "con" at this point.

title: Power Equinix's next phase of growth
pros: - Great place to apply my experience to enable the company to grow beyond 10k employees in 30 countries. - Awesome culture with start-up roots and a workplace where every employee can say, "I'm safe, I belong, I matter." Amongst the best in Silicon Valley. - Amazing development opportunities, with people moving across functional and geographic boundaries. - Top grade leaders and executive team.
cons: - Processes and systems can be heavy and clunky. - Greater need for speed in transformation (but leadership is keenly aware of this).

title: When something seems too good to be true.......
pros: The overall GOAL to a culture is great and sucks you in. Very welcoming at first. You'll get a ton of LinkedIn invites and very "kumbaya" vibe. Pay is actually pretty great for sales if you ask for/negotiate a high base Nice offices if you're located near one (not meaning a data center) You really can meet some great people with amazing hearts here
cons: Very caught up with "who you know" at the company. Super political. Very caddy. A lot of these people refer someone who they worked with in the past or who worked for them for positions. So if you come in taking the place of someone who also was part of this previous crew, you're chastised. If you're not immediately part of the "it" crew, you're screwed. There seriously is not leadership or management (or at least not from what I saw!). If your leader isn't new to his or her position, then they likely are going to do absolutely nothing to teach you, help you, guide you...you're expected to this all on your own or with the help of your team, who all pretty much look out for themselves. Very sad because not at all what I expected from this organization. There's a lot (and I mean A LOT) of talk about being in a safe, diverse, inclusive, place to work....I kid you not, that is not the case. And you're really deterred from speaking up because leadership will know it came from you. There is unfair treatment that is very obvious, and again, if you speak up you're considered a complainer and not a team player. You're encouraged to participate in all of the groups and volunteer and be seen etc etc, however, that goes completely unnoticed or appreciated, especially by leadership. This was very sad to me because it was one of the things that sucked me in. Also, very little opportunity for movement

title: Great company
pros: The company cares about their employees and understand when things come up. Flexible work environment. Fun events. If you are an office employee, they provide lunch usually one time a week, snacks and drinks are free as well. Friendly people to work with and respect your time.
cons: The bureaucracy takes a long time to get things approved and moving forward. Also the Sales organization is a bit chaotic and backlog of tickets to have their CRM updates if long.

title: Was once a great company to work for
pros: Data centers are better than any others
cons: Company has expanded rapidly and the majority of senior management have either no data center or sales experience background and/or they are being hired from a competitor. The company no longer ha the Equinix feel it did in the beginning, it is slowly morphing into it competitor

title: Magic of Equinix is real
pros: Inclusive, diverse, respectful, supportive, customer centric. Just a few ingredients to the Magic of Equinix. Leadership across the company is very inspiring by their actions. Their behaviour reflects a perspective that they work for the people of the company and make it a place where we can change the world.
cons: Very people centric and collaboration is critical to make an impact. Can feel like it slows down the process to ensure socialization of activity. Overall, not a difficult con as it reflects a very people-oriented culture.

title: Outstanding Progressive & Growing Company that REALLY communicates it's vision to the employees
pros: The people. From the interview process to every day working relationships. Even though the internet start up has 'grown up' , it still feels like a family that is close to you , even when you are communicating with fellow employees all around the world.
cons: None at this time. Everything has been first class from the start.

title: Fast Paced, High Growth, Amazing People
pros: Equinix allows me the opportunity to be a part of building out global team. I'm learning and growing by being able to build out global processes, partnering with global teams and learning about how business is done in over ten countries around the world and solving problems on a global level. Management is very engaged with the employee population. They are making a true effort to maintain our company culture and values as we continue to grow at a rapid pace globally. They are engaged with employees at all levels and it is not rare to see them in the kitchen in the office in casual conversation with any employee. They are admired for their open door policy. They encourage being able to come to the table and disagree with an idea and voicing an opinion that may go against the grain but then make the best decision for the business. They are invested in their people, not just the bottom line.
cons: It's extremely fast paced, we've taken on a lot of global projects trying to scale and with that comes growing pains. You have to be comfortable working in an environment where deliverables may change quickly and you will be expected to adapt just as quickly. It can be exhausting but for me that is part of the challenge I crave and love. While at times it can be overwhelming, my manager has always supported work life balance and always listened if I raised the white flag and offered assistance or redirect.

title: Overall, Equinix seems like a great place. But I would not recommend working in the tax department
pros: -Overall, the company seems like a positive place to work; it's just my experience in the tax department that was very poor. -There always seems to be food for everyone in the kitchen -Good coffee -Business casual (even jeans permitted) - if you look this kind of atmosphere -People seem to be satisfied
cons: Again, this company seems great overall, but the tax department was a terrible place to work. I was an intern with moderate excel skills and no experience in tax. I explained this to them before they contracted me. From the beginning I could see that the lady I reported to didn't have the time to train me or to guide me. She would often give me projects outside of my skill/knowledge level (Like I said, I didn't have any experience) and then lose her patience and condescend to me when I made mistakes. I got nothing but a sense of frustration and rudenss from her. My internship experience was terrible - I voluntarily left after 5 weeks. I have no idea why they contracted me, knowing I had such a thin background in this subject. If they post an ad for an 'tax intern', watch out. They clearly want someone with advanced excel skills and a working knowledge of corporate tax. They just want to pay the person $20 an hour and no benefits rather than the market rate. Beware!

title: These are the good old days

title: Toxic place to work
pros: They pay well and provide stock options. Stock price is doing well, but long wait time on RSU vestments (4years). Currently the golden age of co-location with hybrid cloud, but this will decrease over the next couple of years as public cloud matures
cons: Don‚Äôt buy into the hype the culture at Equinix is absolutely toxic. They love talking about ‚ÄúThe Magic of Equinix‚Äù -company‚Äôs cultural tag line. If you find poor team communication, having your work and ideas stolen by your co-workers, lack of any career development ‚Äúmagical‚Äù this is the place for you. They love trying to position themselves as a technology company with-in the Valley, which is comical because they are a REIT and haven‚Äôt actually built anything. ‚Äì Performance Hub and IOA marketing hype are not products. Arrogance and passive aggressive behavior rules the roost. Favoritism runs wild with key opportunities for career and skill growth doled out to the same individuals in key locations over an over again. Tons of job overlap with some teams primary job seems to be justifying their roles by piggybacking on others achievements. Very much a look at me culture with little regard for hard work and tangible results. Talk about yourself long enough and it must be true. Hybrid cloud has ushered in a golden age of colocation and Equinix is reaping the rewards right now, but it wont last. AWS, MS Azure, and Google are going to start taking a serious bite out of the colocation business in the next few years as companies move away from IaaS and into PaaS/SaaS and consuming services via the internet. As SD-WAN providers such as Megaport IIX console continue to mature their services Equinix traditional IX business will further erode customers will see little value in paying premium prices for colocation.

title: B players hire C players
pros: The stock is at an all time high, there's no wonder the glass door ratings are so high. You can't (and won't) complain if you're an employee with RSUs.
cons: We're at a stage in the company's growth where the very smart, entrepreneurial, creative, ambitious leaders - or leaders of the future - are exiting the building. Senior management is non-confrontational (they flat out don't address issues or move them aside), which is classic behavior in a company that is experiencing success. Yet, they are riding a wave that is largely fueled by market dynamics (but they believe it's their brilliance). Our founders got us into this position, not the current management (except the Chairman), and it's the founders who should take credit for the vision that continues to propel the company (yes we are executing, but that's a very different drum to beat). The reason the dynamic, game-changing people are leaving is because Equinix has become a place where politics rule. If you speak your mind you are at risk of getting demoted, pushed aside or fired. At a minimum you're pigeon holed as a problem (don't you know that only the leadership team knows the right answer?) and constantly battle head winds that prevent you from realizing your full potential (and the company from blazing new trails). As new leaders are brought on board or promoted from within, it's incredibly clear that B players rule the school, because they are hiring C players - people who won't speak up, won't push back, will just do what it takes to get by. These people are also the same ones who have little-to-no passion, are yes people, and are not interested in what's around the next corner for Equinix (only for themselves). They will make their bosses happy by not causing any problems, but they (and those who hire them) are the epitome of a Dilbert cartoon. Sad, but true.

title: Stay away from IT (Enterprise Apps) team
pros: Business concept is amazing which means enterprise apps team has survived without adding any value to the organization.
cons: Where to begin. People are treated like commodities: There are managers and their "stooges" who over commit to requirements and make the team work in 3 timezones. Yes, pacific time, Singapore time and European time depending on requirements. When someone suggests improvements they are asked a rhetorical question "So, you don't want to work?". I have seen one "stooge" literally shouting at another member of the team in front of business partners. When asked why she did that, it got so escalated that they went into a smaller room and this lady was shouting and banging her desk. Everything that doesn't work is BSA mistake and then this shouting/ranting begins in earnest in front of entire floor. No program management at the company within IT: This is critically important because being a "global" company there needs to be coordination between business functions. Instead, each BSA is supposed to manage cross functional requirements from discovery, design, implementation, QA, UAT, deployment and support. Release management is a glorified system admin team. Multiple cross functional teams keep fighting (literally) during meetings and whoever has more influence gets the work: There are 2 main IT development teams in Singapore and Sunnyvale/Dallas. There is close to no coordination between them. In fact, there is a lot of politics and infighting instead. Being a BSA dealing with a solution given strict timelines, is a nightmare when these teams can't agree on anything.

title: Chicago location more corrupt than the city itself
pros: Fair pay based on industry standard, though not the best in the market. Based on the expectations you are given, the pay should be substantially higher. ESPP is a good considering their strong presence in market value. Health insurance choices, you at least have options. Decent bonus program.
cons: Where do I begin... Health insurance premiums are way too high for half decent coverage. They provide breakfast twice a week which is probably cool to most people, but Equinix prides on it so much and fails to realize most companies in the industry will offer it daily. Theft in this place is mind boggling, do NOT leave your tools anywhere for a moment or you'll find that it's not yours anymore. Most managers never leave their seat unless it's to visit the loo, otherwise they're constantly calling you to their office and handing new tasks but then later asking to re-do them because the plans change or they're assigning you to a totally different task while your initial one remains incomplete. The most inefficient management staff I've seen in my entire career. Management refuses to take responsibility and are very quick to place the blame on someone of lower rank. The potential reason they do this is because senior management is quick to fire. So it is safe to say most of the management team actions stems from fear in the senior director/VP levels. Policies, procedures, responsibilities and expectations change and grow faster than the company itself. New rules put in place to hurt staff rather than help them, management acts as if "I'm here if you have any questions or are in need of help" which typically translates to "I'm here, maybe not for you... but I'm here". You are a number, NOT a human. If you slow down from a bad day or are simply being more thorough in your work to give excellent quality, they will threaten your job. Yet, on the other side of that... if you rush yourself and make an honest mistake, you're out the door! The choice is yours but it's honestly a double edged sword. I've seen a tech of 3 years, always put in an honest days work, committed to overtime, never late, the epitome of a perfect employee... was walked out because of a accidental disconnect (his first mistake ever). I've seen a supervisor, the only good supervisor they had walked out for protecting his team. Then stripped of most of his life investments while working for the company for almost 10 years. Absolutely no room for advancement in this company unless you'd like to move to California or transfer to the sales teams. The certification and training programs are borderline comical. When I was interviewed, i was under the impression i would be in a system admin or network admin role with all of the OS and networking questions that were asked. Then when I started, I felt baited being only responsible for 3 layers of support. They talk about culture & values, yet you'll only get that in California or in sales. In the data center realm of Equinix (IBX)... It doesn't exist. They'll promise you 10% bonuses annually. No tech has ever seen a full bonus there. I, myself saw 5%. I've seen other employee bonuses even under that. Political class greed dwells in this building at an extreme rate with copper recycling. Beware that these are senior level employees breaking policy but are quick to fire lower ranked employees for small issues. title: Equinix
pros: Good corporate management. Modern data centers that provide best in class up-time and customer service. The company is growing steadily and the stock has performed very well.
cons: Regional management style needs to get in line with corporate management. Regional management is very reactive, needs to be more proactive. Training needs to be more comprehensive.

I'm sorry to say that my experience at Equinix was fraught with harassment, retaliation, and lack of equal opportunities for advancement. As another reviewer put it, it's the quintessential old boys club culture that is thankfully becoming more and more obsolete in the industry. You can do better.

title: Talent Acquisition

cons: Not always a female friendly environment. Career growth is limited - especially if your manager doesn't do reviews or set goals.

title: The Magic of Equinix

cons: nothing to share in this section

title: Poor leadership and inefficient processes

title: Toxic Senior Management
pros: The teams on the ground doing the work are all fantastic. They work hard and contribute fully. They pivot when needed. My colleagues and peers are one of the best I've worked with.
cons: During my time at the organization, I observed that senior leadership often prioritized their own interests and brought in favored individuals, creating a divisive and unhealthy environment. I felt undervalued and treated as expendable, rather than as a valued team member. Leadership was disconnected from daily operations, relying on select leaders for information and making misguided decisions. This resulted in a lack of support, unjustified feedback, and unprofessional behavior, including undermining team members and avoiding direct conversations. The toxic culture led to longer hours, increased stress, and constant shifts in priorities without clear guidance. Much time was wasted on unnecessary escalations and navigating internal politics, which hurt morale and productivity. Career progression was limited by favoritism, and I often avoided advancement due to toxic team environments. Manipulation disguised as change led to delays and disruptions, while toxic behaviors were consistently overlooked. Overall, my experience was defined by poor communication, lack of transparency, and a culture that did not foster trust or respect.

Enjoy unemployment -Nepotism runs rampant - family and friends get fast-tracked while you're left in the dust. -Office atmosphere is so tense you could cut it with a knife. -Mass exodus of talent (5 top performers fled in just 1 month) -Swedish work culture? They've never heard of it. This company is a dumpster fire of toxic American "hustle culture" masquerading as a Swedish enterprise. If you value your sanity, run far, far away from this hellhole. Your soul will thank you.

title: Downward spiral and ‚Äòif the face fits‚Äô
pros: Clean and nice working environments, albeit a little too warm in some areas of the data halls due to ‚Äòenergy saving‚Äô. Can build strong relationships with colleagues in the team. Overtime rate isn‚Äôt too bad Holiday allowance is good, options to buy more etc Opting into the shares is good, good money saving tactic.
cons: Right, where to begin. Firstly I‚Äôll start with addressing the title of this review, ‚Äòif the face fits‚Äô seems to sum up the company and team rather well. There are HUGE levels of favouritism within Equinix, which mainly is what caused me to become a ‚Äòformer‚Äô employee but also the bullish vindictive managerial behaviours also drove me out. Favouritism can be seen across the board, from upper management prioritising specific teams and individuals right down to the personnel actually in some of the teams. I wholeheartedly believe that if you aren‚Äôt willing to become a company robot by living and breathing Equinix and adopting their controlling, vindictive behaviours then you will not progress at Equinix regardless of skill set. For example, there are people in certain positions that shouldn‚Äôt be, ‚Äòengineering managers‚Äô who have never been engineers themselves, how does that work? Management will actively seek out some individuals they just don‚Äôt like and use any tiny negatives against them. Positive feedback isn‚Äôt a thing at Equinix, it may appear in the monthly team meetings but behind the scenes managers will do all they can to find negatives to use against people in the annual pay rise and bonus. Equinix actually adopt a company value called ‚Äòspeak up, step up‚Äô but best believe if you engage in that value then you will be penalised one way or another. Managers do not seem to care about accusations of favouritism taking place. Different treatment is often dealt out depending on who you are, what level you are and to what extent you are liked. If you express a negative opinion in the way the managers operate, then that will be used against you. GPS goals based reward system is utter nonsense. It seems you can write whatever you wish in there but fundamentally it seems as though the annual rewards are based on how much they like or dislike you and how often you raise issues with their management style or the actual core business. If they want you out then they‚Äôll make it known in the annual GPS rewards. Quarterly anonymous pulse surveys were almost comedic. Barely any of the questions in the survey would be relatable to the engineering teams. The questions were largely just corporate nonsense. The survey was never really taken seriously anyway, writing any constructive criticism in the survey would just be overlooked and the favourite way for managers to respond to criticism is ‚Äòthat doesn‚Äôt happen, this person is just being difficult and negative‚Äô. You would find many people to write similar things which would tell me that there‚Äôs a general view or consensus that those things need addressing? But no, not according to the managers. It was very much a ‚Äòus and them‚Äô mentality between the engineers and managers. Cost cutting de motivates employees which only seems to impact lower level teams and employees. No doubt senior management will probably be flying around the globe in business class seats expensed fully on SAP concur all whilst back in Slough there is an emphasis on reducing the weekly breakfast delivered to the IBX‚Äôs. Multi billion dollar company by the way and they‚Äôre worried about bacon rolls. Overtime being cut, team building events being cut, increasing the temperature in data halls to save energy and money‚Ä¶ these things and more just seem detrimental to the lower level individuals. The impact of budget control slides downhill, the senior managers on 6 figure salaries aren‚Äôt impacted the same way lower level employees are. Equinix conduct mental health charity events, offer an employee assistance programme and also provide wellbeing days given to employees as a company shutdown in support of mental health awareness, however if you are off with an illness or even paternity leave, then that will be used against you in the GPS annual rewards (bonus and pay rise). ‚ÄòWe cannot be seen to reward time off‚Äô is a statement often used by the management teams. In my opinion it‚Äôs not about rewarding it, it‚Äôs about treating people equally and not penalising people for things that is also impacting their daily lives. Are employees really meant to feel valued if they are financially impacted during a health crisis? In my opinion equal pay isn‚Äôt exemplified and management will threaten disciplinary action against those who discuss salary with their colleagues. This is against the Equality Act 2010. The same managers also believe that the company policy advises employees not to discuss salaries and if employees are found to do so then disciplinary action would follow. This just gives off controlling managerial behaviour I think. Company strategies and ‚Äòglobal ops meetings‚Äô usually contain the predictable big worded corporate nonsense that in no way relates to the lower level teams on the data centre floor. I don‚Äôt think senior management actually understand what it is the engineering teams do and how fundamental they are to the business which in turn leads to the teams being overlooked. Rival companies offer significantly greater employment packages and poach people from Equinix. It‚Äôs as if Equinix is actually a stepping stone to progress to higher roles externally not internally. College of Equinix it feels like! Engineering teams are always in conflict with one another. Technical issues within the infrastructure are raised by engineers but some often are not acted upon and the issues are then overlooked.

title: annual summary of achievements and highlights for 2024
pros: This company offers some perks but the important ones depend on your manager's approval.
cons: Before joining equinix it is crucial to read the Hindenburg report. This will give you a solid understanding of the industry and clarify why the review ratings have drastically fallen over the past two years. [Both Hindenburg Report and Equinix Statements on the matter are publicly available] The company hierarchy tends to place foreigners and non-white employees at the lower levels while natives and white employees occupy the top positions. [To apply for many things including mobility, roles and projects prior approval from line managers must be obtained, effectively granting them disproportionate authority over employees] Equinix has shifted from a Growth/medium stock to Blend/medium. Since the Hindenburg report managers are primarily focused on their own survival fearing loss of their remaining authority. Many employees have been forced out against their will as evidenced by the slew of negative reviews on Glassdoor. [Reviews in Glassdoor are available and visible] Equinix employs tactics that could be seen as bullying, harassment or abuse to push employees to leave, effectively conducting stealth layoffs for the past two years. [There is no policy on bullying or harassment and every mention of bullying or abuse is anecdotal] Once hired, pay increases fail to keep pace with inflation leading to a gradual but inevitable decline in purchasing power. The company relies on past achievements for hiring and motivation, ignoring current issues and developments. [Latest CPI figure is 3%]

Few people in that org know how to do product in a modern and efficient way, so user value is not properly explored and features not well explained to engineers. This means engineers have to make do and figure it out themselves, hoping they guessed right. There are a lot of circular conversations which go nowhere because product just don't seem to know what they want, and there is very little alignment between and within teams. There is also a slight gap in leadership at the team level. There are good managers and above, who are very supportive, but good TLs are few and far between. There are lots of people who are very competent technically who have been promoted and end up leading teams by default, but they don't have any of the higher-level "glue" skills to keep the team together and moving forwards.

title: Does not value Operations employees
pros: I can only speak to the quality of Operations employees. -Lower management can create a strong team and a great overall immediate work environment. -Site management knowledgeable. -Great company for your CV and to learn to industry. -Sites around the world, could potentially get a job anywhere. -Overall competitive benefits like the RPP match, and health insurance. -EV charging on site. -Company provided laptop and cell phone for work use. -Company branded clothing for uniform provided (shirts, hats, sweaters etc..). -Lunch once a week is provided, quality will vary on the day and sites contracted caterer. -Free coffee and snacks ordered on average every two weeks.
cons: -Easier to negotiate pay as new hires then loyal employees. *(something to consider for anyone applying)* The justifications are completely arbitrary. Multiple new hires have started at higher wages then the person training them. Entire sites staff are being trained with little to no workload at significantly higher starting pay then the established top performing sites that are training them. -Many policies and expenditures around OpEx/CapEx that show they don't care about employees. CapEx budget seems to be unlimited but once the site needs improvements both for the operations staff/equipment and providing quality of life for customers, there isn't any budget to be found. -Every white collar position gets an additional large stock bonus, and generally higher starting pay even with 0 data center experience or service/product brochure knowledge. On top of the generally better schedule and flexibility to WFH. -Less than average starting sick/personal days, Only average starting vacation days. Some of these things differ in AMER and EMEA (EU), for example more vacation days in EU and higher premiums (double NA) for rotation shifts. -Too much focus on DEI when hiring. Above site management were filtering CVs based on checking boxes and deprioritizing people with data center experience. -Old office equipment such as desks and chairs, no budget.

title: Best organisation I have ever worked for
pros: When I am asked what makes Equinix such a special place to work I always say its the people and the culture. Our culture embraces each individual and the unique views and ideas that everyone brings that plays a part in who we are today and what we will look like tomorrow. Our people are our true differentiation Diversity, Inclusion and belonging are not just words that are thrown around loosely but are lived and breathed from the top down. It is part of our DNA. Not only is our remuneration packages generous but the benefits that we receive are industry leading. An example of this is additional to our standard leave, Equinix provide 3 extra days of annual leave to every employee during Xmas . Also when we were forced to work from home due to COVID each employee was provided with funds by Equinix to help set up their work environment at home. However, what transpired recently truly typified the great company that Equinix is to be part of. Equinix recognised the enormous effort and sacrifices people have made over the last 7 months while working through a global pandemic. Equinix took the initiative to give all employees two days off to recharge and refresh. This demonstrated a genuine appreciation of everyone's efforts and sacrifices during COVID. Equinix generosity and giving is not confined only to its employees. Equinix also gives back into the community in many ways through initiatives such as our Impact program. This allows Equinix employees to chose nominated charities or programs to support whether through donations or hours of service, which Equinix will match. This is definitely the best organisation that I have ever worked for.
cons: Unfortunately some of our processes and systems need work to improve our efficiencies.

title: Data Centre Operations
pros: Great work-life balance and a very stable employment. It's a good entry-level position. Equinix offers a range of events and parties where one can meet the other teams and make connections. Equinix IBX Ops department is like an university for people to hang on to for a while, and those who excel can always try their luck and apply for a more mature role.
cons: First and foremost, little room for progression - there is no viable progression line for IBX Operations and this department is quite disconnected with the rest of the business. As the business grows, more and more responsibilities are taken off the technicians and it's easy to get stuck in one role for 10+ years with no extra training and nothing to stand for in your CV. Long term, it's far more reasonable to apply for an internship/apprentice positions in i.e. facilities management or other departments where serious growth opportunities are present and majority of people are hired from within. The remuneration is slightly lower than competitors, especially for a lack of London/Slough location bonus - but it is just 'about fair' for an entry level job like this. There are loads of overtime opportunities for a 4-on/4-off Shift Role though, and most of the people stay for that reason. The salaries also don't really vary for permanent employees and junior team members are often paid the same salary as more experienced technicians. Some that were hired through M&A processes are starting with less than the minimum budget - it is however more a fault of HR rather than intentional.

title: No development, no improvement, nightmarish infrastructure
pros: You work with friendly people from all around the world
cons: Management is slow and ineffective to take decisions. The information and infrastructure that you rely on to do your work is spread across several systems and platforms, which are all too complex and have many bugs, and thus impair your capacity to work efficiently. Managers constantly tell you that "that's how it is" and that "we have to work with it" instead of raising a voice and speaking to superiors about problems. There are incompetent people who sometimes can't even follow simple instructions in emails. Currently there is a fixation with cumbersome trainings and enhancements which really don't add any value to the customer because the infrastructure is full of errors anyways. Even the customers complain about this but their complaints never make it to the people that need to hear it. You are also penalized immensely for the smallest mistake such as not clicking a checkbox when creating a ticket or not saying some words in a precise order during a call with the customer. The salary is not even high enough to tolerate all of this, and there is also very little chance for professional development, not to mention that you will be offered only a B2B (outsourcing) contract.
