cons: With strong growth comes inevitable change. If you want a steady job that won't change then this is not for you. If you aren't passionate about your community, inside and outside of work, this probably isn't the place for you.

title: Cannot reccomend at this time. Management to realize that they, first, have to chang
pros: Financially healthy company (for now). Good place for Sales Reps. Above average work-environment quality in the teams and among peers. Lots of responsibility. No strong hierarchical barriers.
cons: Employees in general seems to be constantly overloaded with work: the resources are not used efficiently nor effectively. And salaries are flat. Few career opportunities if you are not in -at least- a regional HD. Different scenario otherwise. Almost impossible for entry level employees to work their way up nowadays. Few really good managers, general lack of guts and above all lack of empathy towards their own teams. Mediocrity is accepted, at the expense of real Merit. Politics plays a key role.

title: Great place to Work
pros: Community Communication Growth Focus Career Progression Equinix is overall a great place to work. As mentioned above there is a huge level of Career progression IF you put your back into it and make yourself noticed. Unlike my previous positions where you get bored after while, i have not even come close to reaching that point in Equinix after 9 and half years. Great Teams, Great People, would always recommend a great place to work.
cons: Every Company has their individual Cons like any company. It is down to personal Preference and who you are working with. I cannot pin point to a specific con where it would impact an issue to work with Equinix. One Con which is always a big one for me which is Communication. This Cons is in my pros list but some teams or individuals may not be up to par BUT it is always improving. Little nudge and you get what you need ;)

title: Sales Leadership
pros: Culture, People and Customer focus. Quality of the products and services. A fun place to work, but it was work hard and play hard. Great deal of respect for all grades and roles across the business. A sense of shared enthusiasm, values and genuine pride. Quality of the people across the board was very high.
cons: Internal IT could be a little more user focused particularly the collaboration tech, which was substandard for a global business. Benefits package although improving was below industry averages particularly in the areas of base pay, pension, and travel allowances etc. The biggest pain was the sales compensation process & system, or lack of a working one during my tenure. However there was a focus on fixing this in my latter time there.

title: No longer the leader in the market
pros: Global company, excellent committed engineers, Financial controller top notch. Not the highest salaries but good benefits. Great reputation in the market. In terms of work/life balance, I find that is usually down to the individual.
cons: Referring to the title of this review, they face some stiff competition from new companies who have same quality and added values at far lower price. It s difficult to see how they will differentiate themselves and protect churn with that in mind. Tendency to oversell their USP. Became very corporate and new C level management is turning this into another Oracle / HP etc.. Highly political environment, ambulance chasing and not merit rewarding. Its all about saying the right things to the right people . There is bullying and sneaky tactics at play, watch out for those letting you run the sale and then steal your compensation and recognition. If you have value and knowledge to bring, this is not the company for you. Suits those who don't mind spending 70% of their time watching their back and playing the political field.

title: Nice culture but extreme pay gap
pros: Great culture, great people and overall good management (if you happen in the right department ), good benefit package and flexibility
cons: Extreme pay gap in same roles. I have witnessed salary gaps from 10k to 30k. Same roles and responsibilities. No point emphasising salary negotiation and confidentiality for the sake of taking advantage of an employee making them feel stupid and making the other feel great. Ethics/morals should kick in. New employees have better compensation than the old ones, who are kind of pushed to another employer for a better salary. The HR team is arrogant, LIES, and almost abusive when the topic is touched - as employees work not to be fairly compensated.

title: Average
pros: Nice pantry and working environment
cons: Poor compensation and career progression

title: Horrible company
pros: None there is nothing positive to say
cons: Would never work here again

title: The experience was nice but no room for growth as the management is not too good
pros: Nice environment to start your career.
cons: Management just want ppl who can be controlled. Discussing your goals with management makes them think you are not doing enough for the team. Paid less and work load is decent but not good for what is paid. Internal growth should be easy and encouraging but here it‚Äôs not. Here they make it so difficult that you give up. Qualifications are not respected. Even when you are eager to learn the management just puts you down by every mean. Low pay rates. And nothing is confidential - your goals are discussed with other employees and other team members - you can‚Äôt actually trust that your personal goals discussed with your manager will not be discussed with others members in the team.

title: Great company culture
pros: - Great management and zero micromanagement - No restrictions on WFH - Competitive Salary and Employee Stock option - Opportunity to move/travel to different development centres (Sunnyvale, Poland) - Office always packed with fruits, drink - Stable company and JOB - No discrimination between contractor and full time (in Singapore location experience)
cons: - Little scope to opt the teams of your choice (although not zero) - Sometimes your voice been ignored - Salary and perks could be little better

title: Good but not perfect
pros: Friendly colleagues, good business-busy though, good employee stock share buy plan
cons: Work life balance sometimes is hard. Company is expanding and work environment is changing, no or few team building/ party. Even do not know some guys sitting in office. More supporting departments, majorly supportive but some is not help much, like capacity team. I have got feedback many times from Sales support team, capacity team manager is hard to deal. She is very moody. Team has to pick a right time( she is happy) to seek approval for some capacity request. As sales team we all know but we can do nothing as she got promoted by relationship. I personally would not talk to anybody in Management team which is not good to myself. Currently capacity management team just pass what they have to us, instead of standing in our position to work out a competitive solution to win business.Hope management can work out a solution for us. Sorry for the comment here.

title: Normal Pay but no professional career path development
pros: Standardized and organized database. Advanced systems adoption. No bad working vibe among non-management level.
cons: Neglect objection from low level staff even statistic and feedback given. Not welcome new joiner as staff card and computer application is a long progress and a problematic computer will be distributed. Difficult to negotiate with salary increase even workload keep increasing. Standard and procedure keep changing. Difficult to get Management support in license application. Try to use procedure standardization to replace engineering professionalism, not favor engineering staff development Hiring new staff with high salary is much easier than promoting a staff to reach their salary expectation

title: Wonderful place to work.
pros: Genuinely the best culture I have ever experienced. The company is very focussed around its staff and their development. The ethos is worldwide and makes for an incredible cameraderie. Frequent travel to learn, test, share ideas and nurture relationships. It is growing, expanding, and evolving rapidly, definitely a company that is seriously going somewhere. Very easy to share your views with anyone, on any level. A company lives or dies by the way it treats its staff, and Equinix embraces that. For all the everyday moans I hear, it is always qualified by "Don't get me wrong...this is a brilliant place to be". And it is. I am so happy to work here.
cons: Large workload, as company evolves, there is substantial change. It is not one for those that do not like change or hard work. I have only put these in cons as it may not be for everyone....but as we work hard, so do we play hard. And one thing we have in common is that we honestly care.

title: No longer a Great place to work and be careful what you say to management.
pros: Company is profiting and most employees are friendly. Great perks and benefits..
cons: Too much focus on diversity rather then on the business. No longer a great place to work compared to a few years ago as company grows too much too fast and start to focus on cost rather then employee performance. People are starting to be fired for speaking out about improvements. The shift to focus promotion on ‚Äúdiverse‚Äù employees and cost measures is resulting high performing employees to leave or let go and process is turning into a vicious cycle of yes man throughout the management structure.

title: Decent Salary, deteriorated customer service after telecity acquisition and more staff training required.
pros: Data centres across the globe, decent salary and commissions in sales. 3 offices in and around London which gives work flexibility.
cons: Telecity acquisition last year brought many challenges. Telecity acquired staff aren't trained on Equinix systems/processes and in turn are unable to provide the required customer services to the clients, ultimately clients are suffering. High churn risk among the legacy Telecity client base due to poor customer service. This has been communicated to the senior management by several employees but nothing has changed yet. Sales management is generally uninterested in the employees feedback and as long as their short terms numbers are achieved, this long term churn risk isn't something they are looking to mitigate.

title: Was once a great company to work in...
pros: - Everyone loves the stocks, look at EQIX, the growth is just significant every year. - Little perks in the office, snacks, food, drinks - The technology itself is unique and not so easy to be cloned by competitors - Cool looking offices and data centers
cons: - The marketing organisation is very heavy at the top senior level, many directors and not much managers or specialists. People just talk the talk and walk the walk, things keep at a high level and never get executed well. - People just stay in the company for the sake of the stocks. Just for the money. And laid off is not a norm here. Lots of redundancy resources. - Management promoted/hired the wrong people, which bring in a lot of conflicts and unfavourable culture in the team.

title: I'm safe, I belong, I matter
pros: This headline is the tagline of our CEO, and the leadership teams go to great lengths to help employees feel this way. The company values are highly encouraged and the public recognition of teamwork and achievements by both management and peers is a great motivator. During this extremely difficult period the company has strived to bring people together virtually and provided multiple wellbeing resources. Every person I have worked with offers help and support and the team ethic is superb across the globe, I have met so many people from all corners of the world, it's amazing!
cons: As someone mentioned before, the hours can occasionally be difficult due to the varying time zones, but I find people are very aware of this and try to find times to suit all parties where possible

title: Not as good as we think
pros: Some free water, free drinks and free cookies. Famous company name which provide good career profile. Feasible time and feasible workplace. Work from home is a plus for family guys who need to take care of children.
cons: Medical benefits sucks, e.g. no dental for spouse, no prescribed glasses and no health screen claims below age 40. Only one internal toilet and it is water leaking forever. Have to use the shared public toilet with smoke smell always. Low mobile monthly allowance which doesn't even cover the cheapest basic phone data plan in the town. Messy internal document and complex workflow. Only 14 days annual leave which most of the companies already start to offering 15~18 days. Leave system should be count by hours, not day.

title: Equinix EMEA is not Equinix US.
pros: New office, new furniture, fruits twice a week, 180PLN as luch money and annual bonus. Health insurance with LuxMed, office in a nice location.
cons: There is no 401K Plan and there is no career plan as well. The salary is bellow the market. You are eligible to the annual bonus after complete 1 year in the company. There is no technical challenges and due to all those aquisitions you have to handle tons of portals and process and sometimes you expend lots of time consulting them just to have a simple information. The capacitation is based on meetings¬¥s recorded videos and there is no integration between co-workers and departments. Manager and director are far from the reality of the employees and sometimes you have to beg for a feedback. Due of lack of professionals we are working in very tough and tiring shifts.

title: A company on the up
pros: The slough campus is easy to access from M4 and plenty of overtime spread amongst different sites.
cons: A very clicky workplace, you will be employed as an underpaid caretaker dressed up as an engineer. No pay structure, a new starter may join with no experience and be on more than someone who joined a few years ago with lots of experience. The company tries to bring people together, but realistically any days out are a chance for people to brown nose and talk down about others so it's a fairly toxic mentality.

title: Avoid
pros: Friendly team, good culture, big company
cons: Many 12-Hours-long night shifts but you will only get paid $2 extra per hour. You will totally lose your spirit and creativity in 2 years under that roster. Looks like an IT role, but you will spend many hours on cleaning cardboard and rubbish everyday. You can learn very little from the job to grow, no opportunity to move to networking team. Even management encourages everyone to share opinions in quarterly survey, it is formalism as opinions most likely will be ignored. Salary is too low (Lower than security team), Teammates are leaving every month because of the pay, management knows but they don't care. Since everyone will leave after they stay few years in this team, more than half of the team are always new, this makes the job risky and exhausting.

title: Awesome place to challenge and improve myself !!
pros: * Learning something new on a daily basis. Equinix never stop thriving and step forward every time, and it makes me to study more and more to keep up my knowledge base and sharpen my ideas. This is totally a good influence for myself. * Being a part of Family-like community ; Awesome people and culture. Despite not being around each other physically, my team is close-knit like family. Especially, by managing operation 24/7 as one team, helping each other out day by day is making our bond stronger.
cons: * Insufficient Internal resources. * Internal notification / advisories are a bit late to digest sometimes. It would be so great to improve training program as well. We still need a lot more resource to understand our company - especially for new hire.

title: Great place to start,but..
pros: Good stock, aligned with the market rate. Amazing teams' of friendly co-workers.
cons: Low salary, not competitive at all with the Swedish market and as a result people leave.(The entire team which I am part of, get recycled every 2 years) No work life balance. Magic of Equinix culture is an empty promise. Lots of people talk about it but unfortunately many don't walk the talk particularly in middle management.Leadership thinks they have a great culture but it is an insiders club for them only.Poor management and some people resistant to change. High performers are constantly punished with more work and no rewards. The biggest disadvantage you can have in this company is to be a high-performing middle-level employee. You will never move up, but only burn out.

title: Too much Japanese mentality
pros: Compensation is top notch and with a fast growing business, there is a lot of opportunity to grow your role and do interesting stuff.
cons: In many aspects this is like a fully Japanese company and not a gaishikei: - you have to be in the office by 9:30am even if your contract says flex-time - worktime police with punchards - minimal vacation days, only 3 sick days in a year, no flexibility for parents, no work from home - every little expense has to go through so many layers of approvals

title: Low pay, do not be fooled by the name
pros: Good work culture, company growing at an incredible rate, free Equinix gear and merchandise, numerous events, plenty of day offs due to 12 hours shift work.
cons: Extremely low pay compared to industry standards, 12 hour night shifts without additional pay, no overtime pay, "field engineering" involves cleaning, recycling of cardboard, foam and pallets on a daily basis.

title: My door is always open.... not
pros: Same as in any other company, with more fancy words and out in a nice frame
cons: Management is always happy to hear from you, then reject your idea. Put you in their blacklist and start spreading rumors about you to get more leverage to fire. Simple ideas and solutions do not go well as management is trying to get credit on anything and in most cases just stuff it up or get rejected above. Quarterly feedbacks are lies and forced to be high. In return you get to stay employed. Salary is below average compared to the same roles at other companies.

title: The No. 1 Datacenter | Disfunctional Product Engineering
pros: - 3 stars for Equinix as Leader in Datacenter - Reasonable pay with great stock benefits
cons: Equinix strikes all right chords to be the market leader in datacenter and interconnection provider. Where its moving towards Product space doesn't have the right technical leadership. Series of bad decisions towards releasing products, sustaining front office applications gets embedded as products are some of the factors for not enabling Equinix take off to new image. Leaders are empire builders and regionally biased although commit to Diversity and Inclusion. Hallway conversations are trusted over factual information.

title: If you think to start a job here you better rethink it.
pros: Fair place to start. Friendly team environment.
cons: Salary is really low. The responsibilities add up but the pay stays the same. Low morale and motivation in team because of low pay. People that want to stand up will carry the whole team doing triple the amount of work with again no salary increase. Management have no tools to determine valueable staff leading to wrongful promotions and benefits. Management doesn't address or try to fix problems that exist and provided by the staff. Management takes zero responsibility for problems and blame everything on staff.

title: Entry-level position that never became anything else other than that
pros: I enjoyed the facilities and fellow co-workers at Equinix. I feel the compensation was more than adequate for the position. Also enjoyed the scheduling and flexibility as far as taking time off when I needed to take classes and meet other obligations.
cons: I never found a way to turn an entry-level position into anything else other than that. I feel I had a lot of skills and certifications that could have benefited the company, but never found the opportunity to use those skills to move up within the organization.

title: Great company , great colleagues , great culture
pros: A company with a great culture and very helpful staff. I feel like I'm in a big family. Everyone is very helpful and you always work in a team to work on your projects. The cooperation with the management is outstanding. You are heard and understood. Even in difficult situations, help is always provided and a solution is sought. Es gibt viele zusatzleistungen und m√∂glichkeiten sich zu entwickeln. There are many additional services and opportunities to develop. The payment is very good. The cooperation with the management is very good. You are motivated and supported. No one is disadvantaged.
cons: So far, everything is great. Keep it up

title: Strong culture
pros: Equinix genuinely cares about their employees, and the way it has reacted to Covid-19 is testament to that. Management listens, and in response to feedback has brought in meeting free Wednesdays, shorter meeting times and a two day global company shut down. Everyone at any level is always willing to help and support and there is a great culture of recognition. Progression and internal moves are encouraged, so people feel that they have a career with Equinix, rather than just a job. Great place to work!
cons: It's a global company, so there are some early morning/late night calls. However you can always take this time back in the day to maintain a good balance.

title: Great company, expanding almost too fast!!
pros: Perks include Equifest a company spread music festival for employees only. Bacon rolls on Thursdays and bonuses year on year. A generous company paying well for good honest work.
cons: A company expanding so quickly leaves room for issues and missed details. There are a number of processes throughout the company that need honing. It's all looking a little loose with processes now being followed in the exchange for new customers buying collocation space. Selling space ASAP before construction work is complete doesn't fare well with customer site visits etc. Lots to be bolted down.

title: Great company
pros: Salary on market average Good incentives(Bonus and Stock) Great office and office amenities Great team Great work environment at least based on my experience on the Spanish office and on the MS team worldwide Company focused in inclusion and diversity
cons: Sometimes you find people in other areas that doesn‚Äôt fit in company values. To big company so sometimes processes are not as effective as expected. Some tools makes the company inefficient and makes feel employees upset Some areas like Manages Services are left behind, and makes employees feel upset and out of company strategy

title: Fast Pace, Technological Savvy, Open Communication Working Culture
pros: Great working culture revolving around, openness, personal and team growth, constant improving works and positivity. There's a great emphasis on work-life balance, which is truly embraced and exercised among colleagues and bosses.
cons: There is huge pool of resources but as with all modern company, it requires time and effort to sieve through and take time to digest and make sense. It takes self discipline to digest and make sense of all the material. Although the material may be outdated once you've finished reading. Due to the pace of work, it is challenging to gather the team together for group discussions. Although the team generally is very supportive should you need 1-on-1 help (upon asking).

title: Sales Engineer
pros: Company is tremendously successful. Has true market advantage and is far and away the best product in its class. Top Performers are compensated very well. No layoffs in past 10 years. Is envy of competitors.
cons: Is in a period of hyper growth. Senior Management becoming increasingly disconnected from whats going on where the rubber meets the road. Lofty expectations for future state of company. Internal software and processes are lengthy and lack efficiency.

title: A company that delivers on its promises, keeps culture high and is growing in the speed of lightening
pros: Great place to learn and grow, supportive team and cross functional teams Competitive benefits and perks Lots of great team building events Fun people, great culture and great focus on diversity and inclusion Lots of opportunities to grow Supports employees during COVID-19 pandemic and make them feel that they matter and belong
cons: None to share so far. It's definitely a fast pace work environment, but with the great support provided from the direct team and management we can overcome the obstacles

title: Excellent Employer
pros: - Equinix focused on making sure every single person had what they needed to stay healthy and sane during the pandemic. - A friendly work culture that focuses on Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging in the myriad ways that can be relevant. - Curiosity and kindness are rewarded, as are hard work and ambition. - The company is a market leader and consistently profitable, which lends to an optimistic atmosphere.
cons: - Internal politics exist like anywhere. - Sometimes the company can be too conservative in its ambitions. - The strategy and work culture is sometimes too strongly defined by US Silicon Valley culture -Middle management could be more communicative and transparent

title: Promised so much,...
pros: Excellent global footprint and DC solutions, with leading Cloud (CSP) partner access. Great pay and benefits.
cons: Still just racks, power and space sales at end of the day...very expensive when directly compared to main competitors. Family culture is being eroded very quickly in UK business, as Equinix struggles with the difficult acquisition and integration of Telecity and it's customer base in the UK. Serious UK sales imbalance between teams in terms of success and earnings, based on FS sweet spot causing resentment.

title: Mixed feelings
pros: Organizational culture, being on the edge of technology, friendly people and leadership.
cons: Employees grow slowly, even if you are considered a "high potencial". Lots of talents just leave and nothing is done about it. As the company grows, they are trying to align global processes but this might be making the company too bureocratic.

title: There is a reason it's in the list of top employers 2020
pros: I have started at Equinix a little over 6 months ago and decided it's time to share my review. I have previously worked for 3 other companies in UK (smaller as well as larger than this) but so far this is the best experience I've had with employer. Reasons: - Career progression conversation is not a taboo - it's welcome and encouraged, they want you to grow and develop. In my previous job internal applications could be blocked by your own manager as they didn't want people moving from certain departments - Compensation is great with some really nice benefits. I've had better benefits before but what we have here is more than sufficient in my opinion - Healthy work/life balance is encouraged. No one expects me to do any overtime. You can sometimes end up doing it on occasion as you care about the job but then the hours can be flexible. They truly care about your well-being. COVID response has been incredible, they've provided me with everything I need to work from home comfortably - I receive on-going support from my team and management. No one leaves you to "sink or swim". People are happy to help you and always find time. Senior management is approachable - I'm provided with the regular forum to share my concerns and give feedback on everything including my management
cons: Some systems in use can be overly complex and rigid, legacy data can be inaccurate ..but that's about it

title: Great Place to Work
pros: One of the best (if not the best) companies I ever worked to. Lovely place, a good Team and cross teams interaction. The benefits are wonderful. A hell of an EOY party!
cons: sometimes you don't know in which direction you are rowing, the decentralization is a good thing, however the company in Brazil lacks flexibility, and even put an bad eyes on those who push this tendency a bit forward.

title: Bogus Company with ill fated culture.
pros: Nothing can think of as of now.
cons: 1. Company has no values, culture and ethics. 2. They reject the profile after having the salary discussion, they can do anything anytime(if you decide to join) 3. I had a bitter experience with the process at Bangalore development centre. 4. HR don't respond after repetitive follow ups, seems you are only one desparate and they are least bothered. 5. All the best.

title: Flexible and supportive
pros: I've worked at Equinix over 9 years and after having children I was able to return part time and pair up with another sales person to create a job share. This is unusual in a sales environment but Equinix supported us in making this work and myself and my work colleague have work satisfaction and are able to work in a flexible manner and still progress our careers. There are quarterly surveys for all employees and the results are reviewed at each managers level and discussed as a team.
cons: Sales can be a pressured environment wherever you work, however Equinix are very supportive.

title: Awesome company for customers and employees
pros: Equinix staff listens and takes customers and business offering seriously. As an employee, I find various departments teams are responsive and practices good communication. Management team is serious about staff wellbeing which ultimately has good impact on serving customers and service offerings.
cons: None at the moment, Equinix is a stable and growing company. Equinix quickly looks into continuous areas of improvements.

title: Tibco team The worst place
pros: Nothing I can think of.
cons: No clear vision. No work life balance, you work on weekends and late nights almost every day for free, without expecting even an appreciation. No career progression at all at least for 6 years. No respect for employees from management perspective. Always intrude in personal life. Worst discrimination among permanent employees and contractual employees, even in sitting arrangement also. Colonial mindset manager in 21st century, with zero social value and people skills. Disturbs status quo and feed on his own created problems while pointing it to others. More than one medical leave with legitimate doctor's endorsement are looked upon with suspicion. Negligible increments with no benefits. If you join, leave human aspect before and work just like a machine. -These reviews are restricted to Middleware Singapore-

title: Great experience
pros: Great culture, events, environment, benefits.
cons: It's difficult to progress, very often they make progress people with no relevant qualifications and leave behind really skilled and experienced people. I never understood what criteria they use to give roles. Also, some departments are being outsourced, which didn't make me feel safe. Management has too much discretion on employees, I think some decision should be the same for all employees and these decisions should be taken directly from HR instead. For example working from home I think shouldn't be on manager discretion but on HR. There should be more transparency in metrics to show everybody performances.

title: Great Place to Work and Great Compensation
pros: - Lots of flexibility and work-life balance. - Management appreciates initiative and will often integrate employees' ideas into the product. - The salary may not apparently be that amazing but there are large RSU bonuses after the first year that largely increase it, especially if you're working in a lower cost of living country. - Managers tend not to micro-manage and trusts engineers to do the right things. - Possibility to travel to the HQ and to trainings/conferences. - If you're self-motivated, there's a lot of room for growth. - If you come up with a new product from scratch, and you can prove to your manager that you can execute it to release, senior management will let you spend time and resources on building it. Of course, it might take some convincing. - There is legal support for patents
cons: - There is a very large percentage of Indian coworkers, especially in the US, so you will struggle if you don't understand English with an Indian accent or if you aren't used to their culture. - Depending on your team, Agile might be a fancy keyword that covers an at-best-Kanban or at-worst-Waterfall approach. - Promotions/raises are difficult to come by unless you leverage another company's offer. Many manager's have a "everyone should get an equal raise" approach, which benefits under-performers and frustrates high-achievers. - You might get stuck in a project that has very little algorithm work and instead mostly DTO modelling and REST request/response building. Over time, if you don't spend your free time coding by yourself, you might feel your skills have atrophied, which will make you feel stuck in that position as you won't do well in technical interviews.

title: some growing pains, but decent for non-sales related areas
pros: Small enough to be able to get things done. Market leader. A decent product and once you had customers they were generally there to stay.
cons: - growing pains - global integration not quite there - portal for customers is a dog - too many sales people given the market size - not mac friendly in general

title: Great company but clicks among staff
pros: The company is great as far as competitive salary, stable and growing business.
cons: -A lot of clicks within departments (like high school) -Some managers do not interact with their teams plus I have witnessed favouritism -toxic atmosphere among staff -I have seen how people ask other employees to give them "magical mentions "

title: It could have been ‚Äúmagic‚Äù
pros: Amazing colleagues and opportunity for flexibility. Operates at some level as a start up which can be positive on a more personal attention to employees as people and not numbers.
cons: Upper management lacks ability to communicate openly and honestly with lower levels. There‚Äôs still some entitlement attached to people who deliver great sale numbers but are allowed by the company to bully and disrespect colleagues.

title: We are in the middle of the Internet revolution, we are going to be relevant for a long time and I love it
pros: We are working with smart people. I love going to work here, our solutions are relevant for all companies and we can help them a lot I really like that. People are nice, smart and we have a very flat hierarchy.
cons: We are growing very fast, hiring a lot. Can create frustrations if we don't increase internal promotions.

title: There are better companies out there.
pros: Cannot think of any pros when you work with Equinix.
cons: - No work life balance. - Long hour works without appreciation. - Favouritism at its peak. - Internal politics and favourable inclintion towards few employees. - Limited or no growth as company has no policy, only Manager defines your growth. - They can lay you off at anytime they feel. - Unrealistic expectations. Manager adds more to your workload and tells you that it makes you well rounded. - Insensitive towards leaves even in case of serious health complications or genuine issues. - Too much intervention in personal lives.

title: A wonderful workplace!
pros: I feel like I am being taken care of. I feel safe and able to be the person I am both at work and at home. I have a great manager who respects me and trusts me and supports me.
cons: If you do not work in the sales department you will not have the ability to take part in challenges and competitions like many other in the company. The prices are great so it would be wonderful if everyone in the company had the change to win.

title: Needs a lot of crucial improvements
pros: - The best colocation and digital infrastructure portfolio in the world, no chance for the competitors! - Excellent physical structure for employees - High meal voucher - Good environment; people able to help
cons: Fast pace environments are very usual and acceptable, something that I am familiarized with. But Equinix has a burnout spiral culture and this is wrongly considered normal. The work demand is absolutely insane, often out of control. Taking care of a portfolio of hundreds of accounts should not be considered normal. Working as a CSM, Administrative Assistant, Project Manager, Customer Service Agent, Activation Assistant, and Cleaner for obsolete tools should not be considered normal. Being considered the role responsible to make all other teams talk to themselves as they do not basically communicate properly should not be considered normal. The ironic point is: the company organized some mental health webinars and/or web sessions, but we did not have time to join as we were under an huge work demand. Additionally, the CSM wage is very below compared to other IT companies. Lots of good talents leave the company every quarter making the turnover for CSM position one of the highest I ever seen. Company slogan is: "put the customer at the center of everything". But, given what is wrote above I ask. HOW??? The colocation portfolio is awesome. On the other hand, part of Managed Services portofolio and processes are amateur which makes the CSM daily job even heavier. Local leadership did everything possible, however, they were unable to make big improvements as big decisions depended on the CS Directors in the US. I do believe the directors were aware of all problems and, honestly, they don't have the competence enough to do what needed to be done or to appoint a local Director able to do it.
